column4: I visit this location at least one a month they are know for there pizza I recommend staying with that not impressed with anything else in the menus . They are a cash only establishment.
We got a large chicken pizza which was good and tasty but it wasn‚Äôt special! Also, they only accept cash. In overall, it‚Äôs a nice place and staff are friendly. The prices are fair.

We were told the day previous by a Brooklyn firefighter that Manhattan has no good pizza. If he is comparing it to Grimaldi's, then he is correct. None of the pizza we ate in Manhattan could compare. Great slice!
Did a Brooklyn Pizza tour The tour included Grimaldi‚Äôs. Oven baked pizza using Coal Very flavoursome Good service No alcohol for sale Good experience

I was here 4 years ago and had a great experience . This time everything has change.Bad service, covercharge,plastic knife and papp plates.No candles and no beers anymore.I want not come back again.Few people.

column3: Its OK, if you're not from NY
column4: this pizza isn't awful. Enough said. Leave the lines to the hordes from out of town. Juliana's is better. 1800 other places in NYC are better.
Our biggest surprise was there was no line outside, which is not usual. The pizza was great, very tasty and the service friendly. Well worth the reputation.
Great pizzas - come in two sizes: large and huge; and white or red with choice of toppings. The smaller one was more than enough for the two of us. Delicous pizza very reasonable price.
Lucky visit‚Äîwe got a table right away. The weather had turned a little chilly so we didn‚Äôt have crowds to deal with. The pizza lives up to the hype!

column3: One of the best 3 in NYC
column4: If you are told pizza is just pizza send them to this place. Perfect topings, perfect taste and service should be improved.
My daughter school went in the area for a trip and they decided to eta there it was really good pizza . It tasted fresher than your average pizza . Expensive but I understand why

I love Grimaldi‚Äôs pizza with its real New York style crust. And what a pleasant location by our beloved brooklyn bridge. Different toppings make it fun to order. An institution in brooklyn. A must!!!
No other pizza I‚Äôve eaten in the world compares. One of the only coal fired pizza places left in New York. Worth travelling around the world for you won‚Äôt be dissapointed.
Great value. Huge pizzas with good range of toppings. All of us enjoyed it here. And they were playing Abba. A must before a walk over Brooklyn Bridge.

column3: New York pizza under the Brooklyn Bridge
column4: Delicious! Great way to end a sunset walk over the bridge! Glad they were able to accommodate a veg option and use a clean knife to slice the pizza
Good thing my kids brought cash only, no cards accepted. No beer or wine, I don't drink but that may be important for you. Pizza was awesome, great pepperoni

Pizza was ok. Service the same. Didn't appreciate the mystery 5 dollars added to the tab. Was only told upon questioning what it was. I'm sure many a tourist has been caught out by this and tipped anyway. Don't fall for it.
Great pizza in a fun area. Restaurant is mid sized, but a lot of tables makes it feel cramped. They seem to get you seated, fed and out the door. The pizza is worth the trip
Delicious pizza, big portion for value. Slow service though and waiter a little rude. There was a queue to get into restaurant and about a 10-minute wait but pizza was really good.
Next to the Brooklyn bridge. Location beatiful. You have to do a long queue . Pizza is quite good but far away light years from the traditional Italian pizza.
The small pizza is big and tasty. Recommended. I don't think taking the long queu at the competitors (the original Grimaldi) next door is worth the wait. I wouldn't worry about the differences.
Basic inside and no beer. But great pizza at good price. Unique coal taste. Definitely a recommend. Big pizza is perfect for two.
Outstanding Pizza! In a simple looking looking place. Great service, It's the food that speaks volumes! You will be a repeat customer!
Great authentic feel, great pizza. Simple but effective. Went on a Wednesday so the queues weren't too bad at all.

You probably read about the change in ownership, and the lawsuits, and all the other nonsense. But the oven is still the same oven, the ingredients are still the same old ingredients, and it's still really very very good
Pizza is ok but i dont know what all the hype is about. There is nothing special about the pizza here...Over rated to be honest. The best pizza in new york is at Eataly" opposite flatiron builing.
can not recommend this place - it is a tourist trap. Service is terrible and the pizza is nothing to write home about! There are so many better Pizza places in this town.
Terrible service .. long wait.. .. first time in my life i eat in restaurant with plastic knife and fork !! Pizza was terrible .!
The pizza was good. Nothing special special about the setting or the service. It was a real sit down eat off paper plates experience, but the pizza was delicious.

The best New York stile pizza in Brooklyn, arrive early to avoid the long lines. It is the best pizza because of the quality of its dough and its ingredients, its fresh mozzarella is wonderful. The atmosphere is simple, simple with an industrial touch

Bring your cash because they don't take credit cards. Pizza was amazing! This is a nothing fancy kind of place but you won't care when you eat the pizza. Paper plates, cash only, but you won't care after a taste. Highly recommend!
Tried this as part of a tour group so my experience is isolated. Had 2 slices of margarita, such a light and crispy pizza - gorgeous! Worth a try if you've not tried the coal-fired style.
Interesting place with great pizza. You must buy whole pizzas. I was by myself and could only eat 1/3 (two large slices) of a small pizza. Pizza is delivered quickly and is thin crust. Cash only
Deliciouso! A definite visit when in Brooklyn! This is included on the Slice of Brooklyn Food Tour. Best thin pizza in Brooklyn.
Love visiting this place when going over to Brooklyn. There was a line when we got there but it moved fairly quickly. Pizza was very good.
Second visit here and just as good as nearly 10 years ago. Great tasting pizza, quick service, would go back if in New York.

column3: Best italian pizza in New York!
column4: It was raining and the queue was two-blocks long but it was worth waiting, the visa was solo delicious and authentic. A must try when in Brooklyn.

If you like the pizza here, you must be a tourist. Waiters seem to be all Russian or Ukrainian, can't tell. Not friendly. No beer (no kidding). They've got an ATM for which you're charged $4. Stay away!
Recommended by bus tour guide, walked the bridge from downtown which was great and had lunch here... AMAZING! Laid back, no rush, no frills pizza place that tastes great and perfect hosts.
We loved Grimaldi's Pizza! We devoured an entire brick oven Pizza and enjoyed our picnic at the nearby park. Under the Brooklyn Bridge - great view, exceptional food.
Puzza was food for brick oven but we were ignored, never got more water, had to ask for our check.... had to ask for our check to be picked up... if you want true Brooklyn service, try here
Good pizza, but not exceptional. It's a good place for tourists. Service was excellent and the location is great.
Line too long,price too high and simply not worth it.There are so many better places.Coal 87,front street pizza,denino's in the city,dont settle for less
Loved the pizza here. Atmosphere however is busy & loud. Went on the Brooklyn Pizza tour and this was 1 of the 2 pizza places on the tour.

The pizza was good and the staff very kind, the place is very cozy and you can breath the essence of typical american-italian pizza.

column3: Love this place, enjoyed the atmosphere and the pizza of course!!
column4: We made the stop to, in my opinion the greatest pizza that New York has to offer. Grimaldi's is one of my top % in pizza restaurants, and going to the original one made my taste buds and stomach so happy.
Worth the wait, always seems to have a waiting line. Pizza was delicious and not greasy at all. Fresh toppings and great flavors.
This pizza is so good. I'm hungry thinking about it. My first experience and I will definitely go back. I love pizza and in NJ there is good pizza and staten island. This place def top choice.
Long walk to get here but worth the trip, especially with a nice 67 degree evening in July. Great spot under the Brooklyn Bridge, gotta look to find it but worth it once you do.
It was good but the pizza was average for NYC. Nothing Id be craving to go back to and if I was in the area of probably try something else.

Great reviews so we walked 20 min to get there. Ordered Calzone. Maybe 6 slices of pepperoni and a few chicken pieces and loaded with ricotta cheese. Not at all appropriate. Great reputation but not a good experience.
Now these pizzas are large and super tasty. It's quick service. Not overly friendly but efficient. No alcohol yet but says on menu the application is in

Big juicy pizza, spot on. The staff is very friendly and tries to please the customers in several ways. Only cash, but there is an ATM machine on the second floor. Only negative, the olives were way too salted.
great pizza and a place where you can see mainly the locals eating which is always a good sign. good service and decent prices. we went early to avoid the rush
Only Cash, ATM charges minimum $5 and they decide how much tip you need to give them, is included. No good service, personal rude. Plastic plates
Pro: Pizza was good Con: Pizza served on paper plates. Beer and wine not available, lost liquor license. Treated like tourist Cattle

column3: The best pizza I have ever eaten
column4: Thin crust, fresh hand cut pepperoni and fresh cheese. Very casual place where you eat off of paper plates and drink out of cheap plastic cups, Only accepts cash. Service was very fast and as mentioned the pizza is delicious.
I love the entire place, the pizza is fabulous, crispy, fresh, and amazingly delicious. The only r√©serve I have is related to paying in cash! It caught me by surprise!
If you are in Brooklyn, you must stop here to have some pizza. They only except cash, but it is great pizza at a great price and a great atmosphere.

column3: They're gonna make you a pizza you can't refuse!!
column4: A wonderful pizzeria experience. Get there early, she's a popular spot. Experince a spicy taste of NYC

What a great experience. Pizza par excellence. If you are in the locale, or not, it's well worth the journey. Get a large and take home what's left over, if any and continue the enjoyment..I'll be back!

Totally worth the wait! But if you go with a pizza tour like, A Slice of Brooklyn Tour, you get to cut the line!! The pizza is thin and cooked in a coal oven and it taste amazing! Looking forward to our next visit!
Paper plates... plastic cups.. plastic cutlery.... no beer... but the best pizza! These little things add to the experience, definitely worth a visit!
Love this place. They have great crispy thin pizza. If you want something they will make it. Inexpensive.

Great pizza, but long wait. It's located under the Brooklyn bridge, which is fun, but also makes it a hub so plan ahead for that. When we went we ordered ahead and picked it up and we noticed there wasn't much free seating.
Must try this place if you are in Brooklyn. Their home made tomato sauce and mozzarella cheese is just so good and always cooked perfect.

Stood in line for 25 minutes on Friday afternoon. Was a little impatient by the time we got seated. Totally worth it! Perfect pizza excellent host 15 minutes to get our perfect pie jalape√±o with extra cheese. Wonderful! Make sure that you come.
Hands down, the best pizza I have ever tasted. There will be a wait but it is worth it. Bring cash as cards are not accepted nor are reservations.
Fast, friendly and delicious pizza - and the serving size is not small! A great spot to eat in a lovely area to visit.
Lived up to its reputation - great service, and very tasty! Definitely a must visit for a meal. Staff friendly.
Very good pizza. I am from Chicago, so I know pizza very well. There is usually a line to get in, but worth the wait.

Grimaldi's is a terrific place to have a pizza. Our pizza was cooked perfectly with a crisp crust, great toppings (meatball and peppers) and a tasty sauce. If you're in Dumbo and want a pizza, this is a good place to go.
We visit Grimaldi's on a busy Friday evening. The service was fast & efficient. Pizzas were good and tasty. Take note that they don't serve alcoholic drinks.

column3: With 45 min wait in the line
column4: Delicious pizza. Be prepared to wait in line for about an hour but it's so worth it. The pizza is baked at 1000¬∞ and is absolutely delicious

By far the worst NY Pizza I have ever eaten. Soggy crust, fake Mozzarella, service horrible. I would never eat here again. The best Pizza in the US is Totonnos in Coney Island. The very, very best! !!!!

Don't come for the ambiance. Old place. OK service. limited menu but great pizza. We had a white pie with toppings. Never had a white with no ricotta. It was great Lucked out and beat the crowd. Big line when we left.
Very good Italian pizza. Well worth the wait. It was also great to almost watch the pizza making process in Action almost like an art form. Note 1 pizza is enough for 2 people as they are huge

We eat at the Grimaldi's in North Texas and love it so we had to try the "original". Was disappointed after all day of travel that there is no beer to enjoy with the pizza but the pizza did not disappoint. Cash only!
One of the most overrated pizzas in New York. Place is mostly full and can have some waiting. Menu is simple. It would be fun if they serve beer too
Great pizza in Coney Island. Usually a wait. Last time I went there a bird pooped on my head walking from the car, and we got lucky, there was no wait.
This place normally has a queue coming out of the door, lasting for up to an hour or two. We waited for 15 minutes. Totally worth it. One of the best pizzas i ever had! No alcohol served.

After walking over the Brooklyn Bridge from NYC we were delighted to find Grimaldi's. The day we stopped in they were at capacity and still we were seated immediately, our pizza was served quickly and we couldn't have been happier. Can't wait to go back!

We ate here earlier this week when visiting Brooklyn - having walked over the Bridge from NYC. No queue, seated straight away and order came very promptly - really informative staff and very polite. Will definitely call again!!
This is our second time going to Brooklyn Grimaldi's. We have also tried Garden city one, but this is far better. I always feel that line is worth waiting for.
Yummy pizza, cosy place to rest after walking across the Brooklyn Bridge. The owner is a little on the rude side but the waiters are very helpful. I recommend a visit.
Cash only, no slices. Worth it though. Perfect locations, it needs an alcohol license so you can have a great beer with great pizza
The pizza was ordinary, I wouldn't recommend it or go back. We couldn't even get a beer there, which we were looking forward to after a hot walk over the bridge.
Get pizza. They serve whole pizza in sizes for 1-2 or 3-4ppl. Beware they don't yet have a liquor license but are working on it.
Best in Brooklyn. I eat there every time I go to Brooklyn. Its a classic place serving Chicago style and thin crust. Any ingredients you want. Sea food pizza, you bet.
The pizza was good. I like Juliana's next door better. Plus they have a more extensive menu. The service was good but not really friendly.

column3: wonderful pizza's, good value for money
column4: They don't have an alcohol license, so no wine or beer, but the food & the atmosphere makes up for this. I hate plastic cutlery, plus the fact that is very environment unfriendly, but I am a European....

Had a great dinner here in Dec '17 under the Brooklyn Bridge. We walked the bridge and were ready for a great pizza. We weren't disappointed. The surprise hit was the cannoli, the best in NYC. Make effort, it is excellent.
Excellent place to eat a freshy and tasty pizza. The size of tha pizza its gigantic, we shared a small pizza and its superb.

My wife & I shared a small pizza with different toppings on each half The service was good The pizza was superb The only 2 catches They don't have a liquor licence Cash only although there is a eftpos machine on site Great value meal
The pizza was excellent and worth the wait. Although the line was intimidating it really didn't take long to make it.
Pretty good flavor. You must buy a whole pizza so come hungry or with a group. Cash only and no beer or alcohol is served. Interesting old building in Brooklyn to visit.

Quick lunch with my boss on a business trip, his recommendation. The pizza was DELICIOUS! Tasted so fresh, service was impeccable. It's tiny so be prepared to sit close to other people and bring cash - I dont think they accept plastic.
Arguably the best coal oven fired pizza in New York, and therefore the rest of Planet Earth!!! Go off hours or off weekends to avoid long lines.
It's good pizza place but not the best .i felt like it was not worth all the long line .we wanted to try becouse of its famous name .
We were lucky and went just before midday so beat the queues. When we went outside afterwards the queue was round the corner. Service was quick. Excellent pizza. Would love to go again!

Great place cash only no frills but great pizza. Watch the chefs throw the doe through the air and savour the atmosphere. The pizza is big so enough to share one!!!! Price around$50 for two with drinks

If you're in Brooklyn, you got to try pizza from this spot. Busy place, we had to wait for our turn but we liked our experience. What we didn't like was crowding, stuffing of drinks crates on stairs & compulsory tip :)
Get out of the line and go to Juiana's the true Grimaldi's and the very best pizza. You will thank me.
If you don't love pizza and calzone don't go. But if you do walk the bridge around lunch time and head under to sit Feed a family of four for under 30.
Quaint building with very attentive employees. Pizza was fabulous with multiple options. You can watch them hand toss the dough. A lot of history in the building. Sits under the Brooklyn Bridge.
Pizza is fresh pasta is good a little pricey but thats everywhere. Its clean and great service always

column3: Long time Brooklyn resident first visit inside
column4: It lives up to the hype if you love thin crusted brick oven pizza. If you never had one, it's a must try. Not your conventional commercial pizza in New York. This is gourmet.

Went to Grimaldis on a Brooklyn pizza tour from Manhattan, it was the best pizza ever!, baked in a coal fired oven, thin crust, great San Mariano tomatoes , mozzarella and basil. It was worth going to visit Brooklyn.
Hands down best pizza EVER! A good variety of toppings to choose from. Definitely must try if you're in the area.
Best pizza in NYC no one does it any better. Get a large pie for 2 people slices are thin and is the best. Service is fast, missed the old location but this is bigger.
Best pizza in Brooklyn. Period. Superb location, authentic restaurant, great staff. Get there early, or queue! The pies are ridiculously good. I cannot wait to return

column3: Placed was packed...so we ordered take out and ate in the park.
column4: If you love to walk...this is a must do when visiting NYC in the Spring, Summer or Fall. Walk the Brooklyn Bridge and have lunch at Grimaldi's. The pizza is worth the walk!!

After walking over the Brooklyn Bridge, we were really hungry. After about a 15min wait outside we sat at the counter and shared a steaming hot pizza between three. Simple, tasty and super thin crust.

Great pizza - with a thicker base than typical in New York, with good quality mozzarella and a good base sauce. Good location for a walk back to New York across Brooklyn bridge. The üöΩ in the restaurant are pretty dire though.
One large pizza with a few toppings for $32 is not exactly great value but we felt happy enough to pay, given that it tasted good and was a warm refuge on a cold late afternoon.

column3: Rubbish and pretends to be Italian
column4: I wouldn't recommend this, its busy because it's in all the tourist book, pizza itself is rubbish and tastes like Pizza Hut and subway bread mixed together.
All of us loved the pizza recommended by our waiter, the waiting time was too long in the cold. We were interested in the history of the restaurant.

We came here for a family dinner group of 9. The pizza lived up to the reviews . The overall experience would have been better if the staff was friendlier . The owners should think about Some hospitality lessons for the staff .
Cosy restaurant. Service was ok but took some time for the pizza to be ready. Not extraordinary but price was still ok for NY city.

Pizza tour through Brooklyn. First stop was Grimaldi's Pizza. Crust was fantastic!! I've tried the Grimaldi's in little Italy and this one is much better! Nice people and very good pizza! I'll go back.
Prepare for pizza heaven. It's famous for a reason. Great pie says it all. Worth the wait in line. Go early or just plan on waiting
We arrive at 12pm and there was a line!! just wait a little and we order. Pizzas are really good. Not salty like others pizzas, good ingredients. really worth it.
I only eat here when out of town guests insist. The pizza is mediocre and the lines are ridiculous. There are so many better pizza restaurants in the city...particularly in Brooklyn.
Pizza "under the bridge" was well worth the wait! Line moves fast. Crispy crust and fresh mozzarella gave it an 'A'. Liquor license pending at time of review. They only take cash, no credit cards.
The service was quick and the pizza was huge. It wasn't the greatest pizza i have ever had but it was above average. The crust was good.
Nothing fancy - just great pizza. Simply done well and no distracting extras. Will definitely return.
Great pizza after walking the Brooklyn Bridge. The coal roasted sweet red peppers was delicious, best pizza I ever had
The original owners sold the restaurant and the new ones changed the name to Julian's. The old owners opened another pizza place next door. There is still a line waiting to get in
Walked across Brooklyn bridge to try Grimaldis and it was fanatic! We arrived for the opening time and there was no queue.
Very well located under the Brooklyn Bridge, its a must have to do. You will have to wait before having a table, but worth it. Pizzas are good and not too expensive.
Second time I've been to Grimald's, overrated, rude staff, plastic cutlery and not an nice ambiance, no alcohol licence and believe me, a drink might have helped!
Grimaldi¬¥s pizza is a good place to eat closed to Brooklyn Bridge at Brooklyn side, made by italian and latin people and with a good music to eat, listen and talk.
We came here as it had been recommended and it didn't disappoint. No queue, great service, excellent food and a great atmosphere. Would definitely come back
This location is a rock throw from the bridge park! There is nothing more authentic than Grimaldi's, it is the way pizza is supposed to be! Cash only though!
Had to wait outside in line. Was not worth it. Nothing special about the restaurant or the pizzas. We had better in the airport.
Be prepared for long wait times both outside and after you place your order. This is a cash only establishment. Wonderful, wonderful pizza. Show up with a hearty appetite.
Expect a wait. Tight quarters inside. The pizza is well worth it. Easily the best pizza I had in NYC! Get the olives on your pizza!! Yum! Can't wait to go back

Visited Grimaldis during the week having been recommended by locals! The pizza was amazing. A Large pizza was plenty to split between 2 and it only cost about $25 which is great for dinner in the area!
Nice place , but I got a surprise when I order for a bear and the waiter told me that they do not have license to sell alcohol ! üò≥. The pastry was wet due to the tomatoes .
The pizza in focus, great food. Simple dining, but quality all over. Nice prices. The restaurant are pending liqure lisense.
We queued up to get in for around 40-60 mins to get a table for 2. The pizza was really nice and service was fast. Probably not worth the wait however. Worth noting that you must pay by cash!

Went on a recommendation and it didn't disappoint. It's the only pizza I've had in USA but was very good. Service nothing to write home about, as a few smiles wouldn't have gone amiss, but couldn't knock the food.
Classic Brooklyn Pizza in Dumbo. Great value & perfect crust. Cash only & no queue before 1.00 on the day we went....builds up quickly thereafter

column3: Best Pizza in the Whole World!
column4: Get a slice, walk the river, or get two pies! Brick ovens in use still, and it's real NY pizza. Best pizza in the whole world, no joke.

Lines are long for this restaurant, so expectations are high. However, pizza was average: the mid-part rather soggy and crust was not as thin as expected for NYC pizza. Also no alcohol and you're eating with plastic plates and cutlery. Overall a disappointment.

We came here based on place's reputation. These visits usually end up to a disappointment but not this time. Main point here is clearly "keep it simple". They are focusing on pizza bottom and boy do manage that! Worth every coin! A strong thumbs up!
Living off past reputation.. it's now moved to the corner. No beer, paper plates, poor service and forgettable pizza
Worth of visiting, if you are in Brooklyn. Best pizza in N.Y.? Yes, if you do not expect anything fancy.
Wow! Thin crust pizza that rocks! Lots of ingredients to choose from, quick service. We devoured our pizza and ordered another. They also serve beer and wine I think. Definitely a treat.
It is slightly over priced but still better then a lot of other over hyped places near by but still good food
I now understand why the lines are so long. Lucky we were on a tour and could walk right in. We tried 2 different styles and both were yummy. Definitely recommend it!!

Grimaldi's Pizzeria is a must when coming to Brooklyn. We went at 4 pm and was almost packed. The pizza was super delicious. The restaurant is small but was a cute decoration. The staff is ok, nice but not super helpful.

This was a pizza place that looks old and shabby with customer service that was quite average. The pizzas were burnt and lacked flavour. Restrooms need a good overhaul and a clean. The tablecloth on our table was dirty. Wouldn't bother returning.
Straight from Little Italy or Brooklyn, NY. FRESH INGREDIENTS, JUST DELICIOUS. Eat what you want and you do not feel stuffed. Perfect lunch!

First we had to wait a lot. Then we were seated in the bar, not in a table. After that they took very long to take our order. The plates, glasses everything plastic. And the pizza wasn't so good. Don't have anything with alcohol
Old and well-known pizzeria in Dumbo. Their brick oven baked pizzas were good. We were three and had two "small" pizzas to share, which was great for a quick lunch.
We've never really been fans of pizzas. It was absolutely amazing. Delicious, fresh and we will be visiting again. Totally yum. Then walked across the Brooklyn bridge.

This was one of the pizza restaurants on our 'go to' list during our visit to NYC. It didn't disappoint. Well worth the walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and the waterfront is lovely to stroll around afterwards.
We toured Brooklyn after walking the bridge and enjoyed the pizza! They need a beer license ! The pizza folded and tasted like a New York pizza should!

Nice ambiente with good pizzas. From the second floor you can see the guys actually making the pizza. The not so good part: they use only plastic plates and cutlery. This makes a lot of trash and is not very environment friendly :-(
A great place if you want a quick pizza. And good pizza. However, they have no wifi, no beer (!) and they do not accept credit cards. Good pizza, though....
Great place to visit after a walk over Brooklyn Bridge. Simple, good pizza and good value for money. Would definitely return.
We walked over Brooklyn Bridge from Manhatten for pizza at Grimaldi's. Excellent food and great service. No alcohol only soft drinks if you fancied a beer though.
It's the best and that's why you may see a queue. The other place for best pizza is Giuliana's which is close by.
Defiantly the best pizza I've had in a long time. Shame that it was so hot upstairs... That didn't bother us as the pizza more than made up for being a little warm!

column3: This is the best pizza in new york???
column4: Plastic plates, fork and knife?!? No chance to cut edge of pizza... no beer... the pizza was eatable, but this pizza can hide behing most pizzas in croatia... will not recommend to my friends...
Awesome pizza ! A NYC must ! One of the best we have had in NYC . Not licensed so don't expect beer or wine.

Me and my partner ate here as we came off the subway before walking the Brooklyn bridge. Let me just say it was the best pizza we have ever had and great for the price. Great experience inside too good music and polite staff.
Definetly one of the best pizzas I've ever eaten, it can be quite expensive if you get excited adding many ingredients but it worth the money.

The large queue and the shouty manager gives you a true feel of New York. The pizzas were gargantuan and extremely delicious, and the design of the place is nice and very old fashioned, with red checkered table cloths etc. Would definitely recommend.

It is exactly what you'd expect. No frills, just great food. Real good atmosphere and well priced. Great after a walk over the bridge from New York City to stop off here for a slice (or 6) and a beer. Love it!
Food was not impressive. Found pizza to be average. Calzone was cold. Appetizer was ok. They only accept cash, no credit cards!! I was lucky I had $70 bucks in me.

Stood on line for a long time with a large number of people waiting to see what all the hype was about. Finally got inside and ordered a pie... Still not sure what all the hype was about besides the location perhaps.

Some of the best pizza you'll find outside of Italy and it happens to be in the best borough, Brooklyn. Be prepared to wait on a long line. Call ahead of possible and order a pie. You won't regret it.
The place is a bit more glamorous then the picture here. Locals love this place and the pizza is in itself a reward for visit....good atmosphere and service!
Great with a crowd or a couple. Delicious pizza with your choice of toppings. Service is great. Waiters are helpful and suggestive for food choices.
its definitely good pizza but all of us there agreed that they'd had better.Still must try this historic pizzeria in NY.

We had a delicious pie, served quickly by a professional staff. Was it the BEST pizza in NY? That's hard to say, since there's some really awesome pizza in NY, but Grimaldi's certainly makes a delicious pie.
We had the pizza with sausage. It was very nice. The staff is very friendly too. The location is great! And parking was easy to find.
Grimaldis surpassed my expectations. Best pizza crust ever! Service was really good. We also had dessert which was delicious as well :)
GRimaldi's was on our hit list for places to eat and it was certainly popular but the pizza was truly awful. Can't recommend it at all had better from a take-away vendor in Manhattan.
Very long waiting line. Pizza is good but there is many places with good pizza. Not worth waiting. Personals rude and bossy. I do not recommend this place.

Excellent pizza.. Very authentic freshly made pizza. Seating is tight but the price and food are well worth the tight squeeze. Hidden gem under the Brooklyn Bridge. While here you will have an excellent opportunity to photograph the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges.

Very good pizza but I don't understand the line for over a block. It's not necessary but it is very tasty. The only problem is the slices are pretty small from a regular slice. But probably one of the best slices I've tasted.
The food was delicious, staff friendly and prompt with seating us and taking our orders despite the place being overly crowded. And prices are reasonable. Definitely recommend!

I cannot understand the fuss about this place. Ok. The pizza is good, but waiting line is awful. The doorman is rude, unpolite, shameless. Or go when it is empty. Or go to your usual pizza place near your home. üò°üò°üò°

We had friends of our visiting from Atlanta and they wanted to try some of New York's finest pizza. So we decided to go to Grimaldi's. There wasn't a long line since it was in the winter time and the pizza was outstanding.

After walking the length of Brooklyn Bridge we looked out for the restaurant as had heard it was good. Are we glad we did! Amazing pizza, strongly recommend. Staff friendly, surroundings quaint. Would definately return if we visit New York again.
We stop by this restaurant with high expectations about having a real Brooklyn pizza. We are very happy with the experience. The pizza was very good and the staff was courteous and fast.
The pizza is amazing. The atmosphere is old school Brooklyn, the service is outstanding. The place is packed, but worth the wait.
A tip from Tripadvisor, and thankfully so. Some great food, the plain pizza was delicious. Quick service. Note; they only accept cash payment.
Love love love their pizza! Their pepperoni pizza taste so good, didn't taste like anything that you would get from papa johns and dominos.

Stood in line but it moved quick. Sodas and water, pizza, antipasto and deserts...simple. Cash only...they have ATMs on premises. The pizza was incredible, service is no nonsense and efficient. Place was packed. We would go there again.

column3: Winter, spring, summer, and fall the lines are out the door.
column4: I have never stepped foot in this restaurant as I cannot eat carbs. However, the lines are out the door, and people can wait lunchtime up to 1/2 hour. So if you get the drift, the pizza must be outrageous!!!
The coal oven pizza here is delicious. I highly recommend getting the pepperoni as it crisps up very nicely. Only complaints I have is the wait and now thy don't let you call and order to do takeout.
Basic looking restaurant, but great location right under the Brooklyn Bridge - and brilliant pizzas (which you can combine yourself) at a decent price.
Went there with family hard place to find pizzas were tasty and big two pizzas and a T-shirt were $90 there was three toppings on each pizza I would go back I found it to be great
Grimaldi's Pizzeria is on a very popular location under the Brooklyn Bridge. It looks very traditional. You can eat only whole Pizzas no slices from coal brick oven. The pizzas are very delicious.

column3: Good pizza in a authentic ambiance
column4: After walking Brooklyn Bridge, isthis a very nice place to have a pizza. The place is authentic, the pizzas are huge and very tastfull. They are made and baked on the spot, on charcoil. Very nice !
I was told it is very famous. I had the pizza. It is not bad, but I wouldn't go for more of their pizza. They don't accept Credit Card, which was not really convenient.

column3: Wish I had tried instead of Juliana
column4: Grimaldi and Juliana are supposed to be competitors. I visited Juliana but did not like their pizza. I wish that I had gone to Grimaldi pizza. It is 50-50 whether it will be better than Juliana, but Grimaldi is my next choice.
I received too burned pizza while I ordered normal one. I could guess my pizza was used to heat others. I felt I was eating ashes. I didn't claim it because they brougt it for us to eat.
We were treated in such a rude way since we arrived to the restaurant. Although the pizza was good, we will not return to this place and I couldn't recommend it because of the service.

column3: Good place to visit if you have time and don't mind a wait
column4: My wife wanted a New York pizza during our time visiting New York. Long wait to get into the place. The crust was good, but that about the extent of being good. No Beer, just soda's.
We thought the pizza was great. Good place to go when you're hungry after walking Brooklyn bridge :)

Good place, good service and best pizza I ever tried! We got the small pizza and it was enough for 2 people!! The waiter was attentive and all the others were nice. It's a must do before or after walking the Brooklyn bridge!
It was worth the wait to be seated in this restaurant because the pizza was so good. It's a busy place so the meal felt somewhat hurried. Plastic plates and utensils. Not licensed to serve alcohol.
There might be a line and it might be crowded but it's worth the wait! Their pies (pizza) are the best in the city!! You can walk the bridge before or after -or both!- to work it off :-)

Not showy, just great Italian pizza! Service is quick, not a lot of chit chat, always busy, food is great. If you want ambiance, don't go here. The location near the Brooklyn Bridge does not serve alcohol either. Just so you know.

Delicious pizza at reasonable prices. Fresh, tasty and authentic. Love! Love! Love! You may have to wait - around 30 to 45 minutes the night we visited which was a rainy Monday night around 8.30pm. A small pizza is large enough for two people.
The best pizza I've ever tried! The secret of the pizza is the mozzarella, it gives the pizza this delicious taste. Located under the Brooklyn bridge with amazing views.
Loved it!!! It was traditional pizza with lovely blisters. Worth the walk and worth the wait. Cheese was top quality Italian cheese

column3: Doesn't live up to the hype!
column4: Not as good as Juliani's next door. I would definitely recommend Juliani's over this. It's still a good pizza, just not as good as next door.
Grimaldi's is a must if you are in this area. Service was fast, pizza was good. Large pizza will feed 4. Compared with the pizzas in Italy, this is the closest in taste. Loved it, will go back.
The pizza is pretty good! Tasty with traditional Italian crispy bread. I liked that we could see the chef making pizza.. I didn't like the waiter. It's clean but expensive.
This place doesn't have a licence. Nonetheless it's very good. We walked from Manhattan across the Brooklyn bridge - heartily recommend this.
Best brick oven pizzia family owend. All natural ingredients it is a must when visiting nyc Brooklyn. the lines are long but worth the wait.
We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and hunted down this delicious pizza place! I am so glad we went! Service was quick and they were so nice.
Amazing pizza, well worth the long line. Tried the Coney Island and Brooklyn locations. Although the Brooklyn Location had a paired down menu, the pizza was still delicious.
Best pizza I have ever eaten! Nice and clean restaurant, nice and fast service. Will never eat a Manhattan pizza again after enjoying the fantastic taste of Grimaldi's.
Hi all, if you know real pizza from Italy you rate this pizza low average. Friendly is not nice at all and you eat from a paper plate. Not again.
Why go here when the real deal, JULIANA'S, is a couple of doors down? So many better options in New York.

column3: Yes, good pizza, rude staff, gonelsewhere
column4: Honestly, it's a tourist trap. Relying on reputation. Had to wait in queue, then ushered in by staff on phone using hand gestures to show us to table. Should have walked out but we wete hungrry. The pizza was good but not outstanding. Go elsewhere.
This is one of the best brick over pizza's you will eat. Usually a long line awaits you, but it is worth the wait. Menu is basic, salad and pizza and that is all you need !!

Definitely one of the best pizzas I've ever had. We tried both the standard pepperoni and a white pepperoni. I liked the standard (with sauce) better. The ingredients were so fresh and the crust was amazing!

column3: EARN SOME PIZZA AFTER WALKING THE BRIDGE
column4: The pizza at this NYC landmark is excellent, some of the best. The wait, however, could be long, and the setting needs improvement.
We was recomended by a Younman at the hotel for go here. Very nice italiensk pizza, but only serveing soft drinks.
We went there for lunch, we were lucky to be seated immediately. The pizza was amazing ,we enjoyed every slice the atmosphere was authentic and the service was very good.
Title said it all. Very reasonably priced, huge and tasty. We decided to take away because of the huge queue to sit and even then waited a long time - Worthwhile though!
Well area isnt known for great food but still this joint has better quality pizza then most others near by. Food is hygienic and prices are okiesh
Good service and the best pizza I've tasted! Friendly staff! I would rather eat here that juliana's . The line was long but it was worth the wait!
The pizza was good. The staff was fun. Not the best pizza we had in NY, but it was good! Follow me on Instagram to be a part of the journey: my_encounters

column3: Fab location, slice of history and a great slice of pizza
column4: Did this as part of the the Slice of Brooklyn Pizza tour and had a great time. Nice atmosphere and pizza was delicious.
Great fast service, top notch pizza and cheap for NY. If you are a couple and the queue is big don't be put off as there were loads of bugs groups waiting and we got in straightaway
Best place i have had pizza, very busy. Come early for a good seat. Great historic building in the heart of Dumbo and great pics of the city and Brooklyn bridge.

Loved it! Food was great; wonderful kitchen staff. Very nice inside. The selections were wonderful. You just felt right at home. Servers were very knowledgable of selections. It was a great environment!

Of course after seeing on Food Network I had to try it. I beat the 45 minute wait as I was alone. Food and service outstanding but no wine with your pizza soda only and cash only, great place for families

Walked over Brooklyn bridge especially to visit and weren't disappointed. Lively atmosphere and no fuss service. Place was busy and there was 7 in our party but staff found a table for us no problem. Quick friendly service and great pizza. Well worth a visit
Pizza was way overcooked you , plates are plastic,there are no reservation,we waited outside of pizzeria, staff is very nice and kindly,pizza great but nothing special ....
The pizza is your typical thin crust pizza at above average prices. They charge a lot of money for each topping. Been there a few times and I'm not overly impressed with it.
Best pizza ever! What more can I say!! Thin crust, fresh mozzarella cheese and basil. Yummy sauce Worth the wait And they do NOT sell slices. Get a whole pie, you won't be sorry!!!
I can keep typing wow till the review ends. Had vegetarian pizza.. Wow. Crust and sauce and cheese and ingredients. The whole pizza tasted out of this world. Highly recommended.

Small family owned pizzeria underneath the Brooklyn Bridge. The coal pizza oven makes a wonderfully crisp crust. You can't go wrong with any toppings. Thoroughly enjoyed the food. Would love to take the family back when in NY again.

This is a chain of pizza restaurants and I believe this may have been the original. This place makes really good pizza's with excellent toppings. What I like best is the chew of the crust. It's really good. Prices are good as is the service.

We are Italians visiting NY and were expecting to taste something at least close to Italian pizza. The crust was fine however the toppings weren't top notch. olives were too salty, mozzarella not quite that. Atmosphere was quite alright and service good.
Great pizza, great service and reasonably priced. I've had a lot of pizza in a lot of places and this is my choice for the best pizza in New York. No question.

The ingredients were fresh and the pie is made where you can see it. It's one of the best pizzas I've had. The atmosphere is fun with oldies playing in the background and very close to the Brooklyn Bridge
Stopped in prior to Brooklyn Bridge walk. We were seated immediately by friendly staff. Great pizza at reasonable price. Highly recommend if walking the BB is in you plans.
A good pizzeria that is overpriced. You pay for the views and is also very noisy filled with many tourists

Was recommended by a friend and they were right, the pizza was excellent and you can't beat the price. It was busy nonstop and you should expect up to a 45 minute wait but we got lucky and was seated within 10 minutes.
You definitely need to visit this amazing pizzeria... Great hospitality, very kind personnel!! Great ideas for unique pizzas, very high quality, very big pizza, perfect taste!! Need to try!!!

Very busy but staff were very laid back and calm. Lovely atmosphere with Beatles tracks being played. Pizza's are HUGE and very nice. You get paper plates and plastic cutlery which obviously cuts down on washing up but that didn't spoil the experience for me.
The pizza really is amazing. Mine was a bit burnt on the bottom, as some other reviewers have noted, which is why not 5 stars. The service is typical for NYC (bad). Cash only!
Worth the wait. Some of the best pizza you'll ever have. And family friendly. Make sure you are hungry.
The pizza was OK, the small pizza was more than enough for us both. Even though it's a restaurant, the place has a fast food feeling with the plastic cups, plates and cutlery. Not dying to come back.
We were seated immediately upon arrival into the restaurant and received excellent customer service from all members of staff. Our pizza was delicious and reasonably priced.
Long line ups. Way overpriced. Get over yourselves. Not even remotely close to good enough for the price.
Didn't even stay long enough to sample the pizza,plastic cutlery and plates, no beer or wine.Toilets not clean.Glad we didn't stay.
Terrible is the only word for this place. Plastic plates and cutlery. The chicken on the pizza died of dehydration and NOT in a slaughter house

Nice pizza but for petes sake....spend some money on the decor. The bathrooms (toilets to the English) are absolutely disgusting, and you eat off plastic plates. And worst, you can't even get a beer! Poor

Don't let the line up out the door fool you! It won't be long and it's well worth the wait! The two story pizzeria has delicious food, great staff, and a true Brooklyn feel. A must with Every visit to New York!

Old-school traditional New York pizza. Restaurant was once a bank, so the interiors are pretty cool. The line for this place can sometimes be really long, but we lucked out and got seated right away. Enjoyed every bite!

Went there for dinner. The pizzas are big and price is average for New York. The pizza was not very good. The dough was sticky and humid. Would not recommend. I can't see where all the fame comes from...
Needed a quick, wonderful pizza and they came through. Bonus of great reputation. Would enjoy again!

we went here on the slice of Brooklyn tour, eating authentic Italian pizzas under the Brooklyn Bridge is amazing, the staff there go above what you expect, and the pizza, have the Margarita, the views from their front door has to be seen
Went here with a friend on a whim one Saturday morning for brunch. Pizza is great but the line was ridiculous and the atmosphere is medium charming. I'm still loyal to Lucali's.

We ordered takeout 2 nights before Christmas. The veggie pizza was delicious and the fresh arugula was packaged separately so that we could add it when we got home. My husband and son ordered the pannini burger and pronounced it excellent.
We had to wait in the cold in line for a half hour, but it was well worth it. We ordered the sausage pie. I dreamed about it for several days afterwards. Then we walked over the Brooklyn Bridge.
Fast service and good Pizza! Cool to watch them make the pizza. Just the right amount of cheese and sauce
Just really good cheese, really good tomatoes, and really good herbs! That's it, fantastic. We went there on "A Slice of Brooklyn Pizza Tour". On the tour you bypass the line!

One of the best pizza's I have eaten anywhere in the world. Only a short walk from the terrific viewpoint of Brooklyn Bridge/Manhattan, so very very convenient. Pizza was reasonably priced, served HOT and quickly, and was outstandingly good.
Recommended by friends and don't regret the journey. We are staying by grand central station so was a bit of a trek but good pizza and service

column3: Great pizza, the rumours are true!
column4: Heard about Grimaldis and it didn't disappoint! The pizza was lovely though there was a bit of a wait, firstly in terms of for a table and secondly for our food. Good vibe in there too - lovely stuff!

This place has a big name in the NY pizza scene but they are becoming too commercialized. The pizza is OK and maybe even good but there are tons of places that are much better. Lombardi's is one of them!

column3: Walk the bridge have a pizza
column4: Having walked across Brooklyn Bridge it was definitely time to eat. No better place than Grimaldi's to rest your weary legs and eat pizza. 3/4 person was ideal for 3 of us.
Really good, honest no-frills pizzeria in Brooklyn. We made our way to Grimaldi's from Manhattan and it was well worth the hike. Pizza here is out if this world!
You will not regret crossing Brooklyn Bridge to get to this pizzeria. There was only one problem with the food, we did not order enough!
There is certainly something to be said for cooking Pizzas the old fashioned way. Nice atmosphere. The visit was part of a tour but it was very well organised and we were not kept waiting.
Beautiful food, great atmosphere. Would definitely recommend this pizzeria to someone who wants to try New York style pizza
Great pizza - overpriced but fun experience and great area to walk around - sweeping views of Manhattan. Good topping choices and good service. Had a baby with us on line and they let us wait inside

Visited at the lunch time. We wait in line for approximately 20 minutes. But the pizza was worth of it. We took small with pepperoni. It was too big for two. Delicious!!! I will recommend the place for everyone

Seemed to be almost always a queue for a table but we were quite lucky and got seated right away. Simple straight forward menu of pizza served on plastic plates and plastic knives and forks. Can understand why the place is so popular!
There was a queue but it was worth it. Staff very friendly. Service superb. Receptionist very entertaining. Always keeps you updated.
This is a No Fuss.. plastic plates and napkins place.. The taste of the pizza is amazing.. delicious YUM!!!!
Amazing place pizza is so delicious and fresh, truffle dessert was so out of this world.....it is a cash only establishment tho so cards don't go far here
This is, hands down, some of the best pizza I've had - anywhere in the world. This is the kind of authentic flair you can't find anywhere. It's cash only, but worth every red cent!
Worth the trek to Brooklyn and waiting in line in the cold. Best pizza I have ever had and equally great and friendly service. Will visit again on next trip for sure!!
Always a Must stop on my trips to NYC. Ingredients are alwas fresh. This is real NY Pizza the kind people from all over the world come to eat at this national treasure.
Had to visit its a must do pizza place in Brooklyn. the line moved quickly and soon got a table. Good pizza, served quickly.Small was enough for 2 people.

The pizza was great ... I have been to Italy so would not say it was the best I've had but watching these guys make it is really something! It is easy to see how this place has gained so much popularity!!

column3: Great way to refuel after walking over the bridge
column4: One pizza between three of us was fine. We added toppings 'half and half' to accommodate the veggie! Service was quick and staff were really good - turned the music down after a request from my mum who was under the speaker. Well done!
Margerita pizza with homemade meatball and mozzarella cheese + A glass of brooklyn draft beer =perfect!!!!!
This was by far the best pizza we are whilst in NY. Well worth the trip over the bridge and not all that expensive either. Not one to be missed.

Seating is tight, service is OK.. but hands down BEST pizza in town! We stayed in the city but ventured over to Brooklyn specifically for this pizza and were not the least bit disappointed. Will definitely be back on our next visit to NYC!

I really liked the experience, but unfortunately I think it's a little hyped up...the food was delicious and the service was fantastic, but definitely not the best pizza I've ever had. Reasonably priced and great atmosphere. Definitely try it once!

We really loved Grimaldi's!! Super busy, great vibe and delicious pizza!! Went the first time on a Slice of Brooklyn Pizza tour - but then went again on another trip to NY a few months later. Great service!!
The thin crust pizza is to die for. Great pizza, great atmosphere, great location. The owners are there to assist.

After waiting more than an hour to get in, the service was terrible.ii was very dissapointed with the pizza. It's like mass production, i felt rhst they were hurring us up im order to seat other people. I will not recommend this place

Pizza was very good. I was disappointed that I could not get a beer or glass of wine with it. We waited for 30 minutes to get in and another 45 minutes after ordering, The pizza was worth the wait though.
Tasteless overall, soggy and chewy crust. Cheap but not worth the wait. Try Totonos or diFaras if you want good Brooklyn pizza. Any of my neighborhood pizza joints are better.
Looked forward to this meal for weeks. No surprise it was exceptional. The history of the place was also excellent. Would definitely go back

column3: If you want pizza, go there
column4: After reading all suggestions to go for pizza there and standing outside in the queue in 27 degree sun to get in, it was worth every cent! Best pizza and then work it off across Brooklyn Bridge back to Manhattan.

column3: As long as you like Pizza...
column4: The lines move quickly, and the pizza is excellent, thin fresh dough, with fresh mozzarella slices, cooked in a very hot coal fired oven.

column3: This was on the list and it did not disappoint!
column4: Stood in line before it opened. Was not disappointed! The pizza is that good! Make sure you bring cash, that is all they accept. The service was quick and the food is great!

definitely wort a visit after walking across the Brooklyn bridge! GREAT atmosphere, FANTASTIC authentic pizza, good selection of toppings and drinks! we were told to take cash! i think they don't accept cards!

I was in NYC last week on vacations , everyone recommend me Grimaldi's for a great pizza experience and omg i was great , good service , awesome pizza , love the place i would recommend this spot to my friend in ny !!!

column3: A must when walking to Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan
column4: Have been here many times over the years, but this was my first at the new, larger location - food did not disappoint and now with the improved waterfront, it's an even better destination.

column3: The pizza is so good I want to marry it
column4: The crust is amazing. The mozzarella is homemade and jaw droppingly good. I highly recommend this place. I went to this place while on the Slice of Brooklyn pizza tour, which is also very good.
Had to try it once....long wait..nothing special..... I prefer Arturos on Houston. Save your time....go around the corner..it's better.
it has the worst service and the pizza is not good at all. Dont even come and waste your time ! We asked 3 times the bill, i think they dont want to earn money.
The pizza was burned, and we had to wait 45+ minutes. Terrible pizza, terrible atmosphere. Don't go.

In a famous pizza place like Grimaldis, have to Wait in line is normal.. Be patient, will worth it! Service and long food Waiting are the weakness.. But the tradicional and pepperone pizza are delicious!!! Hard to park The car. Will come back for sure!

Had better pizza from dominos, server was more interested in looking out the window,not once asked if everything was ok,or if we required another drink, totally ignorant, and unprofessional, plastic plates & knifes and forks, will tell people to keep away.
Great pizzas with some unusual toppings for us visiting from Iceland. We had to wait a while for a table but it was worth the wait.
Great pizza, decent enough service. Absolutely always busy, so not for those who appreciate quiet or much space.

Read reviews that we needed to eat the pizza here while in NYC for the first time. It did not disappoint. Fast service and delicious pizza!! Ordered one pizza and was large enough to share for four people.

column3: Fun place to get pizza and see Dumbo in Brooklyn
column4: Not the best pizza in NYC, but a fun experience. The Brooklyn version of Grimaldi's is in a nice neighbourhood called Dumbo. Close to Grimaldi's you can get the best views of Manhattan from the pier.
Definitely a place to go in Brooklyn! Authentic coal-fired pizza and the white pizza is unbelievable!
And not worth the wait. Plus no booze, wine or beer. Only soft drinks in a plastic bottle and plastic cup of ice.
Grimaldi's is my very favorite pizzeria! Discovered it 6 years ago and finally got to go back. Don't worry about the line, it's worth the wait!
Visit this restaurant by tripadvisor. Perfect Pizza's good to share with your friends and fear prices The nice thing was the plastic plates and fork and knife. Not expected but nice.
Service d√©plorable, pizza sans go√ªt, pas d'alcool, √† √©viter ! restaurant for tourist, tasteless pizza server that treat us like animals and no alcohol! to avoid !!!
Yes the wait was long- but I don't regret waiting;-) I think that was the best pizza I've tried -at least so far! The prices were ok. The stuff was nice. Highly recommended!
Great pizza, visited for a late lunch yesterday with my daughter, their Margurita pizza is delicious....nice, thin, light crust.

Great pizza, nice cheese , good topping choices and fun nostalgic atmosphere Service leaves something to be desired, but I'm a Seattlite living in Brooklyn so that seems pretty typical but all in all good pizza for the price
Great tasting pizza and brilliant soda. Its queued round the block but the tour has tables booked. Went as part of the Brooklyn pizza tour. Part of a great day out in New York
Exceptionally rude "Host" treating everyone like dirt. Pizza ok but far too much tomato sauce resulting in a wet pizza base. Recommend getting the white pizza instead.
Plastic plates and cutlery and no alcohol does not distract from fine pizzas. Everyone was happy and they kept coming. Toilets were unpleasent but you go for the pizzas, enjoy them they are good.

column3: Summer Friday's after the fireworks in Coney Island
column4: This is a nice place to have some pizza and salad with the family/friends after some nice fireworks BUT make sure you get there before they end because it gets packed....

column3: Doesn't live up to the hype
column4: I like thin crust pizza and Grimaldi's is supposed to be better because the oven is coal-fired. What I got was a pizza with over-cooked cheese and a burnt crust.
Really great thin crust pizza in a relaxed atmosphere. Can get quite busy, so going off-peak hours is recommended. Beware: they only accept cash.
This is one of the best pizzas in NYC. It is worth the lines and wait. I have never been disappointed.
Had to wait for a time to get in. There are a number of street side restaurants that offer pizza that is just as good. But it is a landmark so if that gives you bragging rights.
Awesome pizza! We had to wait in line for 45 mins but it was worth it. Small pizza fed 2 of us easily. Cash only but there is an ATM in the restaurant.

This was our first experience of NY pizza. We combined with a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge to get there from Manhattan. The queue to get in looked impossibly long but we decided to stick with it and were totally glad we did.

Very old historical type building. Bathrooms up the stairs, not handicap friendly :( Pizza very tasty but extremely thin for me I felt you paid alot for not much on the crust. Would I go back..no not worth it.
Pizza was fantastic, staff was friendly and helpful, prices were reasonable. What else can you ask for? There's nothing quite like pizza baked in a coal fired oven.

The pizza was good however we were directed to a table and later asked what we wanted. That was the only communication we had with a staff member. They are used to filling the seats without being at least polite.

column3: RERRIBLE PIZZA USING GRIMALDI NAME> JULIANA'S NEXT DOOR IS THE ORIGINAL GRIMALDI'S AND TASYES IT. GRIMALDI'S CONS U FIND
column4: Not worth the hype or price!!! @ best a slightly less than ordinary pie.There are 3 better pizza parlors on the same block as Grimaldi's.
I don't know if it is the best pizza in New York as some people say, but sure it is a very good pizza, if you're in Brooklyn it deserves a visit.
Lots of tourists Line outside when we went Moved quickly Good thin crust pizza loaded with cheese not much sauce Limited menu pizza and antipasto - for example salad not an option
Got there early for lunch and beat the lines. The pizza was great. Nice walk back across the Brooklyn Bridge.

We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge, and this place was recommended to our family as a "must". Delicious pizza, family atmosphere, casual . Prices reasonable, and all pizza available with your choice of toppings. But be aware, no credit cards, cash only.

We enjoyed the most delicious pizza. We took a Brooklyn pizza tour and Grimaldi's was our first stop!! Amazing mozzarella, not greasy pizza. Sauce delicious and fresh basil and a touch of olive oil!!! The best Margarita pizza I have ever had. A must!!!!
One of The best of the pizza I have ever eaten . The warm service and the personal touch plus the mouth watering pizza offerd here .mdo not miss .

One of the best pizza spots in Brooklyn! Yes its gets tons of press - but the lines, waits and pies are worth it. Lunch is usually quiet at Grimaldi's so worth the risk. My mouth is watering thinking about it!
Decent pizza, but much too touristy and popular. Long, long waits at any time of day( in the hot sun). Up the hill Frascati's on Henry almost as good.
You will cue for this pizza because it is likely to be some of the best pizza you will eat! Definitely worth the wait, if you have time go taste this pizza it is ridiculously good!
This is a famous pizzeria with great pizza! Definitely worth the wait in line. We got there around 7:30 and the line went pretty fast, it seemed to get longer later.
Went for lunch with a friend and we shared a pizza. It was so big we weren't able to finish it, even with 2 of us eating. Service was efficient and quick.
Pizza is Brick oven and delish. eat in or take out. Thin crust,great sauce and an lots of cheese! Bring the kids family friendly!

Best pizza ive ever eaten!! Went for lunch. Very affordable menu. There was a queue but it moved fairly quickly. Service was very efficient- 'no frills' approach which we liked. We got to meet mr Grimaldi! Great location for tourists. Excellent experience!!
Really great Pizza, interesting history. Highly recommend visiting. All the staff were very friendly.

Under the brooklyn bridge and nake great coal fired oven traditional naples style pizza. Worth the trip over the east river if you love pizza. While your there get some great shots of the brooklyn bridge and the Manhattan skyline.
Excellent taste and value. They delivered and food temperature was still satisfactory. Gluten free pizza is excellent.
We went at an off hour to avoid the famous lines. It was worth the trouble because this pizza was out of this world and unlike anything that I have tried in America.
This is my favorite pizza place in the U.S.! I have been about 5 times and it is great every time. Take the subway from Manhattan and take in the Brooklyn sights.

We came here as it was recommended by friends! They had nice pizza but nothing to brag about like everyone makes it out! It has really large portions and 2 people could share a small pizza! Overall it wasn't too bad! Great customer service though

Had been told we had to come here for pizza and wasn't disappointed. An experience in watching them making and taking out our paperbag pizza where we ate in the park..Cold beer would have been nice but we survived. Felt very authentic !

column3: Good pizza, give it a try!
column4: Went to the original location under the Brooklyn Bridge (well, the bldg they just moved into). Fun atmosphere, good food. The only downfall was no liquor license so after a hot walk across the Bridge, a cold beer would've been VERY welcome!!
Tasty pizza. You have to pay in cash, so be prepared for that. Each topping costs another $3 or so. It's right below the Brooklyn Bridge, so it's a fun area to explore.

column3: Famous restaurant for a famous pizza
column4: Very close to the Manhattan Skyline, very crowded but the pizza definitely worth the waiting time especially when you could discuss with the boss
The pizza is good because it is not too hard and too soft. Various choices of toppings to please anyone.
A very ordinary experience at this restaurant, the staff did not seem too bothered if you were there or not and the pizza i had was large but pretty tasteless.
We walked the bridge from Manhattan then ate at Grimaldi's. It was good pizza. After the walk I would have liked a beer, but their liquor license is in the process.

column3: Part of A Slice of Brooklyn Tour
column4: Margarita pizza supplied as part of our tour together with a drink. Plenty of it too. Thin crust - very good. Italian atmosphere in the restaurant. Good
Definitely loved the pepperoni pizza! Crispy ooey gooey goodness! We had to come here again before we left back for new jersey and we were thoroughly pleased with both visits.
I have been going to this place for years, it's a Brooklyn landmark. Many fond memories. Delicious and scrumptious pizza! A friendly cozy place- you will enjoy it!

I was a little bit sceptic at the beginning...considering all the publicity about this place...but...but...I can confirm that the pizza is very very very wonderful! Discover this place in Brooklyn, absolutely!

People really hype this place up, which is why it is always packed with tourist from all over. I've been there once and the pizza is pretty good, but I'm not sure that I would go back because of the discouraging long lines.

Would not be worth a long wait. We got there early enough and went right in. Pizza was good, when we left there was a long line, our first comment was that it was not that good. Meal was very reasonable price wise.

A classic thin base with fresh premium tomatoes and the finest basil garlic marriage, stunning mozarella and finest italian traditional cured meats, makes the perfection, the words are not enough; Maybe the best Pizza in New York City;

Okay, it's old NYC. The kind that goes without scrutiny, I suppose. But this pizza is SOGGY. Nice ingredients? Check. Grumpy servers? Check. But the pizza is SOGGY. So really, it's silly to wait in line for this stuff.
Loved the food, staff were hit and miss. Only soft drinks which was a bit disappointing. great meal though and cheap. nice way to walk the bridge then eat

column3: Good reward after the Brooklynn bridge walk
column4: Can't just buy a slice of pizza..it a whole pie type place. Pizza was good. Service not so much, had to get our own water pitcher to fill up our glasses of water. But fun old town feeling.
Delicious pizza ... Fresh ingredients.... Grimaldis is the BEST! If you want great pizza come here... Cash only though
This a regular place as I visit NYC about 4 times a year. I enjoy the food, the local and the service. Always a GREAT value. Be sure and walk down to the East River and if time the Promenade.

Whilst travelling along the Brooklyn foreshore towards the bridge walk, it became a line out front of this pizzeria. Going with the people flow we experienced the best pizza in New York we have found. Absolutely fabulous pizza. Excellent service. A New York/ Brooklyn must.
We visited Grimaldi's pizzeria after seeing positive reviews; would highly recommend this place; the pizza was amazing and the location was really nice! Great tractional NYC pizza!!

Cousins and I visited the pizzeria at Hoboken. The pizzas we ordered are really nice. Though can't compare it with the Italian ones I tried, cause this is the Booklyn one, none the less the quality is still good.

Grimaldi's may be a tourist favorite, they won't disappoint you. Pizza's are generous and delicious, service is fast. Reasonable price. Went with my appetite and a friend, we shared a large pizza and it was just the right quantity.
If you want simple food, the menu is just that. Tasty authentic pizza. Loved the rustic atmosphere. Be aware, no alcohol for sale in this pizzeria but that doesn't matter as the atmosphere is amazing
Some of the best pizza in Brooklyn right here. Get the antipasto. It is simple and just plain delicious. I have been to some of the franchises with mixed results but the original is great every time.
Waited in a HUGE line and I thought "will it really be worth all of this" well let me tell you it was! Superb pizza, superb location and great atmosphere. I hope to visit again soon !!

column3: Just good pizza, that's about it
column4: I have always wondered about the best pizza in new york - grimaldi's.. yes, it is good pizza but that's about all.. No need to go to Brooklyn in case you have business there. New York is all about good pizza..

My first trip to Brooklyn and first official Brooklyn Pizza. Flavor was great, coal burning crust taste took a bit away from flavor on burnt spots. Was just amazed how chewy the crust was...very chewy.
Pizzas were tasty hot. Once it cools, the cheese is chewy and heavy. Staff were nice and quick. Good place to eat at the end of the Brooklyn Bridge.
A fantastic pizza. Big sized With the best-tasting dough I have ever eaten. It smells Italy. The chicken was good and also the ingredients tasted homemade. Nice atmosphere and you get value for money
Thoroughly enjoyed our meal at Grimaldis underneath Brooklyn Bridge. The pizzas are great value and truly delicious. Will visit again!
very good, big pizza but they haven't license for alcohol. You can create own pizza (to add ingredients which you like).

column3: Great pizza, quick service and value for money
column4: Recommended this morning by Debra the guide whilst on the Gray Line Down Town tour bus. It did not disappoint. Visited at lunch time. Great pizza, quick service and value for money. What we could not eat was bagged up for us to take away.

When we went to Grimaldi's, the wait was down the street. We decided to try it. This restaurant has the best pizza in the world! The pizza is made on a coal brick oven. There is no other restaurants like it!

When you visit NYC this is a great pizza joint with historic stories of the Brooklyn Heights neighbourhood it calls home. The line ups can be long, but they move fast. Service is fast and friendly. The coal fired oven cooks the pizza perfectly.
This was the greatest pizza! It was thin crust and oven baked. It was served hot and quickly after we sat down.
Upon arrival the first thing we saw was a big sign on the door saying what they wouldn't do for us...No Slices Cash Only!
Pizza was incredible, service was quick but you need to get there early to get a seat as the line forms quickly. The food was also very reasonable.

So often restaurants don't live up to the hype. But this one surpassed our extremely high expectations. The pizza was incredible - a real winner. The owner even came around to check on us ... old school.

column3: I still feel the taste of that pizza
column4: I wish to go there, right now... Please. On cold January as we walked Brooklyn Bridge we were wonder what smells so good, and after 20 minutes we found it. It was the best pizza ever. Thanks.

column3: You have to go to the original
column4: There are a few Grimaldi's and it seems that this location (the original) is the best! The pizza melts in your mouth - so good.

column3: Like communism countries lines to eat
column4: The place always is busy, the service is rude, you can't even ask about the kind of pizzas, the automat answer is: all pies only..and look to the customer behind you.. like next....
One of the top 5 pizzas to be had in NY. They've opened one in Coney Island that is much easier to get into (at least for now) and the pizza is just as good as the parent place. Go there.

column3: Super Awesome Pizza ..... Crust Rules ... MMMM MMM Very Good
column4: This is One of the Best Pizza places in NYC ...Sure there Are a lot of Pizza Joints ..but this has a Special Feel and Smell too it. Great Service Great Menu ... Lots of fun.
Had a great time. Stopped in for lunch and the service and Pizza were excellent. Talked with the wife of the owner and she was very pleasant. Overall I highly recommend it...

column3: There are two Grimaldi's in Brookyn
column4: The pizza is amazing !! However the crowd and the lines in the location in dumbo is ridiculous !! Try the one in coney Island !!! Abosoulety no line great service and the pizza is the same !!
First off this place is right off the Brooklyn bridge, which does not get better then that! the pizza is great and service is fast! If you want the best brick oven pizza it‚Äôs worth it!!
There is a story behind this place and it hasn't had a happy-ever-after ending. It is convenient to the waterfront area however. No slices.
don't know why people stand in line for their pizza. there is better pizza around the corner and on the waterfront.
Beautiful pizza we had the medium and it was very large we had to take two slices home, quick easy and good service. Very reasonably priced. Thank you.
It was really horrible taste and services. Pizza was totally burn out. I am curious how to maintain their business.
The restaurant has moved Your photo is at least 3 years old and out of date. It was sold a number of years ago.
We visited on Wednesday and because it was bitterly cold there was no queue. We had a large pizza which was lovely and enough for 4. Highly recommended.

Came over to Brooklyn so we could walk back to Manhattan over the Brooklyn bridge and Grimaldi's had been recommended by friends. It didn't disappoint, the pizzas were great and there is a great atmosphere here.
It is crowded, uncomfortably so, and the pizza is not nearly as good as Di Fara's. Not worth the wait or the disconfort.
despite of waiting in line, it¬¥s a good experience eating a pizza at Grimaldi's. after crossing the brooklyn bridge don't lose this pizza.
Ate here on New Years Day - caught out by the 2pm opening time (holiday) - very long queue prior to opening - well worth the wait - great pizza!!
I walked over from Manhattan over the Brooklyn Bridge, staff is very nice and friendly. food is quite good :)

I'm not a pizza connoisseur, but I know what I like and this was the best pizza I've probably ever had. There was no waiting to get in. We just walked in after walking across the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan. Great atmosphere. Friendly staff.

This well known great stop on the Best Pizza list is worth the stop. You have to buy a whole pie but the pizza is really good and well worth the effort. If you go in the good weather and eat outside its even better.

Grimaldi's was on our to-do list just as much as walking the Brooklyn Bridge. We chose to eat first and then walk the bridge. The pizza was good, the environment even better. We definitely felt like this place offered up a true Brooklyn experience.

column3: Taste of New York Puzza-the best!!
column4: Enjoyed this soooo much, taste of brick oven pizza! Staff was amazing and had the best best root beer and Black Cherry cola!!! Best pizza ever!!
No trip to New York is complete with a slice of the good life and I mean Pizza... One the the best pizza in New York ..,
One if not THE oldest pizza joints in NYC, Grimaldi's is a must visit -and the pizza is unforgettable. Recommend weekday visits to avoid the lines.
If what you want is great thin crust pizza then this is the place....ideally located near Brooklyn Bridge Park and Dumbo, the only draw back is the long lines....
I've been to Grimaldi's quite a few times and the pizza is always worth the wait. Some places get a lot of hype and don't come through, not the case with Grimaldi's.
the pizza was good, the menu is very limited and its cash only. The staff was also rude and we felt rushed.
Nothing more so say then that this is the best pzza in the world, and that they realy keep the Corona icecold
We waited 40 minutes outside in freezing temperature to be seated in a corner table we could not even move. The pizza is not tasty at all. No salads, no beer, no wine !! Would not go back again .
Yes, it was simply awesome. It's yummy, the best pizza you can find in New York City. It' near to the Brookly Bridge so after a ride or a pretty walk trought it it's perfect.
Wonderful experience - first class service and pizza was just wonderful! Great menu choices and lots of soft drinks to choose from.

We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge then stopped at Grimaldi's. 20 minute wait in line outside the front door on a Saturday afternoon. Worth the wait. Pizza hot, fresh and good. Fast, friendly service. Cash only.

We were told that theres usually very long queues for this place when we got there got seated almost straight away, pretty basic looking place , waiters made it fun, pizza was good would eat there again,
Great service and great pizza in a really cool old building - we were in town for a family wedding and wanted to try this famous pizza restaurant.

Delicious pizza by the pie only (no slices). Go when it's warmer outside. Send a friend to wait ahead of time. Leave your stroller in the car, there is no room inside. Very crowded with as many tables as they could squeeze inside.
A disappointing pie. The crust was flavorful, but limp. The cheese not nearly as tasty as John's Pizza in The Village. Good use of fresh garlic. And no beer! Not worth the wait.
Pizza was good, disappointed with no liquor! states license applied for... not sure how long that's been in the works, but if you are doing the walk across the Brooklyn bridge you should try it!!
Worth while standing in line for this pizza. Not the friendliest, but efficient service and missed a glass of wine with the meal, but he pizza was good!
The pizza was good but the best part of ordering pizza there is that you can take it out and eat it at the Brooklyn heights, if the weather is nice it is a fantastic spot to enjoy the pizza.
Brick oven pizza at its finest. The sauce is great. Pizza was cooked just the way we like it. Wish the location had a parking lot. The parking around the area is very difficult
I dont really understand how this restaurant has been chosen as the best pizza place in Newyork.. My pizza was half burned and the ingredients were really ordinary. I just liked the cheese..

One of the best pizzas I've ever had, great service, didn't take too long to get a table. The sauce is a little bit too sweet for my taste, but it's still a very good pizza. Worth the visit to Brooklyn.
It is, hands down the best pizza I've ever had!! I would suggest trying the Margherita.....Although, be prepared for a wait. It is well worth it!
