Absolutely the best pizza I have ever had, and that includes in Italy. Simple pizza, perfect crust, and very reasonable prices. CASH only, but ATM on site!!! Worth the trip without a doubt

The pizza was amazing! The location right next to the bridge is great. The smallest pizza is pretty darn big. I barely ate half of it. I got a pepperoni pizza. All of the ingredients were super fresh. I would definitely eat there again!

column3: Misleading photo. The photo is of the original grimaldi's which is now Juliani's and a far superior product than produce
column4: By the average place passing as Grimaldi's @ 1 front st. Patsy Grimaldi makes pizzas @ Juliana's(HIS MOTHERS NAME)

column3: Family visit, for the first time
column4: Very quick seating on a late Wednesday. No alcohol served. Pies cooked perfectly to order. Ordered two to feed the five of us.
Great place to visit. Best pizza anywhere. Right under the Brooklyn Bridge, great atmosphere. Fun place I had on my bucket list :)
Great little pizza place- fairly small restaurant but the pizza was to die for- the kitchen is open so you can watch them making your food! Lovely staff and great food- we had a fantastic time.
Simply the best pizza I have had anywhere in the world, do yourself a favour, enough said, go there.
The pizza is fantastic. Is it worth lining up for an hour for? Nope. Order take out and go eat in Brooklyn Bridge Park. Awesome stuff!

When you're walking across the Brooklyn Bridge, take the route that seems to go under the bridge. Grimaldi's is right there. When we went, there was a long line. However, it moved quickly. The pizza is good. Cash only.
I was very disappointed. My friends and I felt like the pizza had absolutely no favor. The only favor you got was from the brick oven. Sauce nonthing. Will never vist again.

The place is very old school Italian and the line is usually around the block. I have never actually dined inside the place because the wait is just too long. Had the take out and the food is very good.

column3: I go here all the time
column4: I have been here countless times. Everything is awesome. Even though I'm gluten free I never miss eating a few slices. Love it. Love it. Love it

We had heard a lot about this restaurant and its renowned pizza and we were really looking forward to a delicious meal. Unfortunately, our pizza came out with a half-cooked base and was average at best. Service was efficient though.

After reading all the hype about the 'best pizza in NYC' and the 2 hour long queues, we arrived with high expectations. We were not disappointed. 10 minute wait, awesome $30 large pizza with 2 toppings and the best canoli ever eaten.

Just have a great pie sit back and enjoy. But they don't have a liquor license so have a cherry soda, and relax! There here's another pie shop next-door, the difference is minimal we love them both, !

column3: Great Grub Great Prices Great location
column4: Dont miss it, Make a point of going. Its well worth the walk or ride.Great pizza, excellent value. Freindly staff....

The pizza was amazing! We ordered the marinara pizza and the margarita. They were both really delicious and the dough of the pizza was just perfect. I will say the sizes of the pizza are very large so make sure your super hungry.
The pizza was perfect. Try pepperoni and have black cherry wishniak soda to drink. The long line moves quick. We went around 1:30pm and didn't have to wait at all.
45 minute wait for 2 people. Then we were inside 15 minutes before anyone even took a drinks order. If you are thinking of going, I wouldn't bother
I love the pizza here, I have been to Grimaldi's twice in Brooklyn and once in Vegas. We enjoyed the pizza at both location, note that the one if Brooklyn is cash only, but is worth it. Enjoy
It is worth the wait! I loved the pizza - loved the experience! Learned about other great things to see and do while I was in line waiting. But we had fun talking to people in line!
This is the one of the most famous Pizzeria in brooklyn and in the city. If you have patience to wait you will taste one of the best pizzas ever eaten. Try it !! Enjoy !
Don't believe the hype. I went because of the hype..checked it off my bucket list and moved on to better eats.
we went right when it opened up in the morning at 11.30. there was a line up to get in when we were done eating. pizza was outstanding. the small size is more than enough for 2 people to share.

If you want the absolutely best pizza while in NYC, visit Grimaldi's in Brooklyn Heights. Great location, under the Brooklyn Bridge, at Fulton's Landing. Great views of lower Manhattan after you have a great pie !!

column3: Great! I could just eat their crust
column4: So good just give me some crust and sauce I don't even need their toppings it's that good. Typical NY service. Who cares eat their food.
Pizza is crack....great place for groups. Give the guy at the door $20 to skip the line. It's worth it. After you finish walk down to the water and have ice cream on the pier.
Top 3 pizza places in NYC. Best to go on a Tues, Wed or Thurs night. Give the guy at the door $20 to skip the line.

Way too long a line for mediocracy. Grimaldi's is now running on old time reputation, not something they still live up to. It's a shame too, because tourists come here expecting a little piece of NYC history.
Line up was a little long but not hard to understand why once you try the pizza. Absolutely wonderful! Would definitely have again! Wish they would sell by the slice.
No frills, but awesome pizza. No liquor license at the new location, but don't let that deter you. There will be a line to get in, but it seems to move quickly, and the staff is friendly and helpful.
Too much hype. I much prefer joes or bens pizza. Not so impressed. I wouldn't wait on line for that. The atmosphere is nothing much. But it is a cool old building

column3: New York Pizza for West Coast boy
column4: Yum, the Pizza came quickly, it was tasty, and we were seated as soon as we arrived. I appreciated that they keep the price reasonable. Service was friendly and fast.
Excellent pizza!! Def a must try!! We didn't have to wait in any line that I heard I might have to do but when we left there was a line starting!! We went around 11:30 am
It looked great but It lacked taste. I went all the way to Coney Island and I was extremely disappointed.
Delicious pizza. We didn't have a crazy wait- maybe 15-20 minutes. Service inside was a little slow and lacking but overall good pizza and good place.

Excellent value for money and great tasting pizza. The small pizza was enough for a family of 3. Had to cancel the large when I seen the size of the small. The staff were very understanding even though they had already prepared it.

column3: Worst Restaurant we visited in NYC/BRKLN
column4: Menu is terrible, they do not tell you they don't serve beer until after you have already ordered. Tomatoes were green. Service was SLOOOOWWW. Avoid this place.
The pizza was great but would have liked to have seen some salads or even breadsticks or subs also on the menu

column3: Should be call - Minimal Service Pizza
column4: Did wait much to be seated, but waited 42 minutes for pizza and during entire 60 minute stay the waiter stop twice: to take order and give bill. No beer or wine and cash only. Oh and pizza is ok.

column3: Line so long for just a regular pizza!
column4: We were in line outside for one hour! The pizza is not bad but it just taste like any good pizza! Their calzone is huge!! I went to Vegas a week after this and saw it fashion show mall with no line.

column3: OK pizza but worth the experience
column4: Obviously went through the ‚Äú20 minutes waiting outside experience‚Äù. Once inside it‚Äôs nice to check out all the pictures hanging on the walls. The pizza is good but nothing ‚Äúwow‚Äù and the service is average. But it‚Äôs worth the experience.

column3: Great, but it ranked Juliana's better
column4: Great pizza, not great service though. It's almost like they see too many customers and simply can't be bothered. Juliana's next door is MUCH better in every way!

Being from texas we have limited pizza options but they do include a franchise grimaldis which is not bad but does not compare to this great place. It was worth the 30 min sub ride from hotel and walk during this 90 degree day

column3: Will stop here every time I visit New York.
column4: Pizza is fantastic, perfect crispy thin crust and great flavor. Coal oven pizza is one of my favorite ways to have pizza. Servers are not very friendly, but price was good less than twenty bucks for a meal for two is great in New York.
A delicious pizza to eat everywhere. I bought it and ate at the Dumbo park and it was a really nice experience. Place looks also nice to dinne in! Try both options!

This place is a tourist trap. It's just famous for the sake of being famous. It's not even in the top 20-30 places I've had pizza. I had to wait 45 minutes because the oven was being cleaned and the pizza wasn't even average

Average comes to mind. Not sure what all the hype is about. Luckily we got there early and didn't have to queue for a table. Staff were not friendly. Eat somewhere else in DUMBO, you won't be missing out.
Very average pizza. Waiting line went quickly but the pizza was just average. Quality ingredients but not what it is cracked up to be.

column3: Perfect way to celebrate walking across the bridge
column4: Perfect pizza. Perfect atmosphere. Perfect staff and service. Well done! Only thing I would change about this place would be to accept credit cards. Come on guys, this is the 21st Century.
Fast and accomidating service...............especially since they were packed.Excellent food ,especially pizza..... Getting there and finding parking was the only issue.
To us Canadian, that small pizza is a large size so you have been forewarned. I did not see anyone ordering a large pizza. The line up there was long too.
The music was too loud and inapropiate, the service was bad and the bill was at least not very clear.

column3: I have no idea why people stand in line for this
column4: Very dull, tasteless pizza. Very little sauce, and the crust was burnt. Uncomfortable chairs & small table -- no room to breathe. The restrooms were a mess. Skip this line.

We had a white pizza with fresh tomato mozzarella garlic and extra fresh basil. Was good but not great. Also a red mozarella pie. Thought sauce s little bitter. Good enough, but after reading reviews would try Juliana's next door next time
If you want pizza in New York this place is worth the walk across the Brooklyn Bridge. Best we have had. Keeps things simple pizza choice of toppings & bottled drinks.

column3: I'd cross the Brooklyn Bridge for this
column4: Really good NY pizza! Great location, great atmosphere. Just under the bridge on the east side. It's a younger crowd with lots of music. The restaurant is in an old historic bank building.
we all know God is great! but when he wants pizza he go's to Grimaldi's. just pure pizza , they way god intended it!
Best photo op of the NYC skyline around the corner. The pizza is great, be prepared to wait on line.
If you like a good pizza, made your way, just go there. Great people also run the place so you're sure to be taken care of.
My friend took me there and it was a huge line but still got in. The owner was super nice to us. Gave me a free root beer!!!! Amazing Pizza and place and staff.
What do you think about 55 min waiting for a simple pizza? No smile. No cards. No alcohol. Just anti human... No entry!

Hands down the best pizza I have ever ate. Crust was thin and crisp. Toppings were great but honestly sauce and cheese are all that's needed. Line was not too long with about a 15 min wait. I could eat this pizza everyday
coming from Regina's territory in Boston I would definitely say this pizza is worth a visit. great sauce and crust and reasonable for New York.
Not even in Italy I tried a pizza as tasty and perfect like this! The place is great and pizza is crazy. Price is perfect! Dont miss out. Maybe you will have to wait in line but it totally worth it.

column3: One of the 1st pizzeria's in new york
column4: pizza is great but be prepared for a long wait as it is very busy. It might be hard for smaller children to wait on line.
Excellent pizza great service....no beer but water and pop we were good with. Must do while in Brooklyn my suggestion take subway there then walk across bridge much better view
This place does THE BEST coal baked margarita pizza. So delish! It is a quiet little joint not far from Brooklyn Bridge.
Nice thin crust pizzas where you can see them make the crust and build the pizza from your table. The pizza maker was constantly busy. Wash it down with a bottle of pop and you are good to go.

column3: Not the best but good enough
column4: Waited 30 minutes. Not bad on a sunny spring day. Good pizza, not the best. Crust a little soggy. Anti pasta fair but would go back.
Must eat here if you like pizza. Great taste nice atmosphere. Right at the corner of the skiline. Wouldnt miss it. Prices are fair!
This place definitely has one of the best pizza's I have ever had. The lines to get into the restaurant kind of sucks, but for good food it is pretty worth it.

This pizza is simply delicious. The restaurant is charming; service was fast and friendly. You can watch them as they make the pizzas...very cool. Thin crust, fresh mozzarella, delicious pepperoni. Best pizza we've had in NYC across three long visits!Only cash!!We had a nice lunch!!
A classic New York establishment. I was worried when they moved from their original location but the food is still amazing and now they can accommodate more people
Pizza is all right.I grew up in Brooklyn and there is a few better place without the line and tourist.
I traveled to this Pizzeria after reading about it some place. It was by far worth the trip. I love Pizza and consider to be very picky when trying new places. I would say the best pizza ever!!

column3: great pizza close to the bridge
column4: This is the best pizza this side of the bridge...take patience with you because lines are long but well worth the wait. Summers are good here for obvious reasons!!!

No slices, medium pie would be enough for 2-4 people, no more. Hard, crunchy crust, freshh mozzarella, tomato & basil, additional toppings extra. Another location is on Coney Island, we visited both, same quality, Coney Island nice view facing the beach.

column3: Great Pizza at a good price
column4: Great Pizza at a good price The only downside is that at times you might need to wait hours before you can be seated which is kind of crazy. I suggest you call before going.

We loved it here! The pizza was delicious!! Nothing but crumbs left after we got finished!!! We caught the water taxi to Brooklyn and had a wonderful, tasty lunch here under the Brooklyn bridge. It was a great memory

Very enjoyable pizza, a classic NYC experience, like going to Lombardi's, that needs to be done. For me though, not in the top 10 pizze I've ever had. Make sure you try the ice cream shop down the hill afterwards for dessert.

column3: Good but NOT Worth Standing In Line For
column4: The pizza is good but it doesn't live up to the hype. There's nothing extraordinary about it and it's not worth standing in line outside for 45 minutes for.

Fantastic NYC pizza with friendly service and no pretension. Weird spot nestled near the base of the bridge on Front street but a great building. Brilliant prices and we loved that you just create your own pizza. Beautiful

This pizza is simply delicious. The restaurant is charming; service was fast and friendly. You can watch them as they make the pizzas...very cool. Thin crust, fresh mozzarella, delicious pepperoni. Best pizza we've had in NYC across three long visits!
I loved it here!! Pizza was thin but delicious. Reasonable prices. Great service from great guys !! Yummy in my tummy !!!! Worth the check out
This restaurant doesn't need a long review I just want to say the service and price is great,but the food is magnificent it really is the best pizza in New York !!
My wife and I have been to Grimaldi's several times and enjoy it. However, our son, who lived in Chicago for awhile, prefers that style with its much thicker crust and more generous ingredients.

Having heard this restaurant mentioned on CSI New York, decided we had to try and find it. We did and weren't disappointed. Got there early so no need to queue. .Great Pizza and desserts - if you can fit them in!

column3: Walked over Brooklyn Bridge to eat here and soooo worth it!
column4: Best pizza I've ever had anywhere in USA! Big fan of NYC Ray's Pizza, but this is way better. Heads up though - can't buy slices and they only take cash. Highly recommend you go. It's right across/under the Bridge.

The line was ridiculously long...but it was worth it. This place is small and you end up sitting right next to people you don't know. But you end up eating some of the best pizza ever. Worth the wait. Period.

column3: Best pizza I've had in my life
column4: The pizza was amazing like how we could put red chili flakes and fresh parmigiana and franks red hot it took along time for it to come but it was so good.Next time im in New York I will be eating here again.
Great, great pizza but do expect a wait. This is a well-travelled destination for people walking across the Brooklyn Bridge. Its gotten pretty touristy but it still is some of the best pizza in NYC.
Had heard great things of this place and wasn't disappointed, one of the best pizza we have eaten would defo return! Another plus is great views of the bridge from the bottom of the street!
Pizza was good but not the best I've ever had. I liked the thin crispy crust and the fresh mozzarella but the pizza didn't have a ton of flavor. I expected it to be amazing, but it want.

Don't be deceived by the huge line, you will get in. We waited on a Friday night for about 30 min. After the pizza arrived, I could see why the wait. Brick oven crust, fresh toppings--it all makes a difference!

column3: True NYC pizza, well worth trip to Brooklyn
column4: Visited Grimaldi's upon recommendation found on the internet and were not disappointed. Great setting, busy place, incredible pizza - great tomato sauce, fantastic mozzarella, magical touch of true basil and very good dough as a foundation. Be sure to pay them a visit :)
There was a big queue when we arrived but were seated fairly quickly. Service, food and value for money were all good.
Simple and great pizza. Waiter isn't friendly, but the service is efficiently. Great place to go with friends, the restaurant have a good price, but you need to wait in the line to enter.
Love the regular pizza with double helpings of pepperoni and its great with a few flakes of chilly on top. Yummy and uncomparable to any other pizza.
Thin-crusted and baked to the perfection. A great pre-sunset program is to walk down there from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. Waiting lines are common out front.
When we decided to go we had really high expectations for the place. Our friends told us that the line is long to get a table, but it's totally worth it. AND it was !!! The pizza was delicious!
Good and big pizza. Also the price is reasonable. You can pay only cash, no credit card! And you have to do a very long line!
I though that when it is so famous it will be bad or very bad - and for turists. It was very good. The ingredients were fresh, nicely matched. Very tasty. Worth visiting. Quickly served.

A great place to visit if you are in the Brooklyn Bridge Park area. There was a line about 15 minutes before it opened. We're seated and served quickly . They are brought our drinks right away. This was a unique eating experience!
This is some amazing coal roasted pizza! I've tried alot of different pizza's & this is the best by far! amazing fresh base.
It is a long wait to get in and a long wait for pizza to arrive. But when the pizza finally does arrive I have to admit it is fantastic. Not overly friendly but we thoroughly enjoyed
This is the truth, nothing but the true NY pizza. The ambiance is not the same as the old Grimaldi's, but what matters is the pizza, and it is still the same!
Great pizza but the line was long at 8:30 didnt get in until 9:20 and pizza by 9:50. Prices for pizza are great. Quality ingredients.
This was my second visit to Grimaldi's Pizzeria in two years...and once again I found the pizza to be average and the service to be surly. Why they is usually a wait is beyone me.

Amazing pizza. So simple, yet perfect. 600 degree coal fired ovens bakes your pizza in 3 minutes. Thin crispy crust, but still firm enough to fold and eat. Literally 100 people in line!! (Tip: Take the Brookly Pizza tour, and skip the line)

This is a "Must" go to pizzeria while in New York City. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge then we had the Best Pizza. My son had seen it on the Food Network Channel so we had to find it, and I'm glad we did!
The pizza was delicious and priced right. Do yourself a favour and take a trip to Brooklyn. DELICIOUS!

column3: We waited how long for cardboard?
column4: The pizza her is just not worth the hassle to taxi over from Manhattan.too thin and to be honest the biggest let down of my trip.

The restaurant was located right under the Brooklyn bridge. Really cool place to eat traditional New York pizza. It was worth the trip there. The pizza was so good. Fresh made Mozzarella cheese-everything Seemed fresh-not packaged. Pizza at home will never be as good now!

column3: Great pizza, if you are in the neighborhood.
column4: After the Brooklyn bridge walking tour, we ate here. A little bit of a wait but worth it. No thrills but A/C was nice. Would not come all the way from Manhattan just to visit the place.

This I was some amazing pizza! I wish I could have packed this pizzeria in my suitcase and taken it home with me! The pizzas are cooked on a coal heated brick oven. The big pizza chains like Pizza Hut, Dominos, Papa John's...ect
Best pizza I had in New York. There was a line but it went pretty fast. Was able to watch the pizza being made. Yummy!
Great Pizza, well worth queuing for. My partner is vegitarian and opted for the White Pizza as she dosn't like Tomatoe's, it was as she said perfect.
Waiting line but it went quickly and service was fast for pizza too. Fun location in Dumbo under the Brooklyn Bridge. Restaurant was very crowded though and warm. It was a very hot day outside.
Mysteriously, to me, there is always a long line waiting for seating at Grimaldis. As Brooklyn Heights residents, we braved it once and wouldn't again. The pizza we sampled was average.
Usually the queue at this place is long, but luckily there are no queue when i go there. like the Pizza a lot cause it has generous portion of meat and like the dough as well..

It was very good but the food and line did not live up to the hype. There was a 45 minute wait (outside), limited menu and good food (not great food). The location under the Brooklyn Bridge is fun and we enjoyed the experience.
Yum! Biggest yummiest pizza ever! Washed down with their house wine. Cosy atmosphere, no frills. Worth a visit

column3: Service is terrible but pizza is simply THE BEST
column4: Don't come here for great service. Come here for great pizza. And then after, walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to work off that yummy finger licking goodness that is Grimaldi's pizza.

This is some of the best pizza I have ever had and I am born and raised a New Yorker. They use fresh mozzarella, homemade sauce and the crust must be made with that famous NY water because it is simply delectable.

I had a good experience here late on a weeknight. After walking across the Brooklyn Bridge, we were tired and hungry. We got right in and the pizza came quickly. It was wonderful and went great with a Brooklyn lager.
was spent inhaling their amazing pizza and Calzones. The 2 hour line is worth the wait. Yummy yummy yummy......
Great pizza in a great place with very nice service. If you come around lunch...be sure to come early since there is always a line outside. This place is very popular...and I understand why!!!
Great this crust coal pizza. so classic and fresh. Such a great experience every time I go. Delicious!

Even before the move and the loss of their famous coal oven, Grimaldi's has long been overrated. After the original owners sold it, the pizza has been inconsistent and never spectacular. Waiting on those long lines for average pizza is insane.
The pizza and location are great. I stopped by on a walking tour of New York/Brooklyn and it was timely and tasty. Prices are reasonable for a bite to eat at a historic pizza joint.
Worth the wait :). Just across the Brooklyn bridge which we walked; best pizza ever with homemade tomatoe sauce and fresh ingr√©dients, cooked in coal brick-oven. we loved it!

This is the quintessential NY pizza restaurant - huge pizzas, fantastic sauces and toppings, all washed down with Brooklyn lager. Great atmosphere and the best place to eat cheaply in New York - make sure you're hungry!

column3: reward for walking the Brooklyn Bridge
column4: The wait staff were really friendly and just like New York. The pizza was really tasty. The restaurant is just across the Brooklyn Bridge on the Brooklyn sode.
A long wait (1hr+), raw pizza and sausage topping. Took the sausage off but pizza tasted bad. Worst tasting one we ever had.

column3: A lot of pizza for your money.
column4: Really good pizza at this place. We ordered to small pizza's. One each, it was really way til much for us. Good value.

column3: New York's best pizza institution, now tragically compromised
column4: A year ago, this was the best pizza joint in the city. The energy was electric and the pizza was amazing. When they moved next door, something was lost. What a tragedy. The pizza might taste the same, but the experience has changed forever.

Nestled under the Brooklyn Bridge, Grimaldi's offers a great NY-style pizza at a fair price. We enjoyed a couple of great pies, then walked across the Brooklyn Bridge to revel in the Manhattan skyline at night. Not a bad way to spend an evening.

We enjoyed a tremendous pie. Sauce made of crushed imported Italian tomatoes...fresh slices of mozzarella...delicious Italian sausage...and a crust straight from heaven. It lives up to the hype, and is worth the wait. No slices, no credit cards, no delivery. Just great pizza.
We picked a chilly night to stand in line, but it was worth it! Wonderful pizza, perfect crust. The wine is good too.

I strongly recommend this restaurant while you visit Brooklyn. The pizza is good and the service quite good as well. You have to share table, but it was no problem as long as you are confortable with it.
Get there early and avoid the always present line. The white pizza was fantastic. Atmosphere is so so, but the pies are unbelievable.
Eat here before or after walking the Brooklyn Bridge. The menu is simple, but the pizza is great. Slice sizes are generous. Note "cash only".
Get there early or at least at a off time for dining. Great food, cash only no cards. Pizza was heavenly.

We stumbled on this place as tourists, and were very impressed! No long lines when we went (late lunch) and still lots of excellent choices of slices. It was by far the best pizza we had in NY. We'll definitely go back.
I thought this maybe one of those of places where the reviews are great but you go there and the pizza is average. wrong. super delicious pizza. pricey though but worth the price
Awesome pizza place located just under the Brooklyn Bridge. One of the best pizzas we've ever had. A must visit while in NY. It's very nice also to walk by the river after dinning at Grimaldi's.

There was no que when we arrived. Sat on a bench with a few other people and had great pizza. Nothing left to say really, only we went at the right time as there was loads of people queuing outside when we left.
I go to the one in Queens. It's nice Pizza. Very basic and consistent. The sauce is good and the dough is nice.
Pizza was pretty good! The pies are doughier, and not as crispy as some of the other places I tried. The pizza was very cheesy, and was better than I expected!

column3: I was shocked when I saw a long line in front of the restaurant
column4: Dont know how they do it, but the line was long .Not impressed with the pizza,It's not worth to wait

The only thing impressive here is the location. Not impressed with the pizza or the service. Rude would be a good word to describe they treatment we received. Pricey, too! Don't bother, there's too many other better pizza places in NYC.
The pizza is OK, but it isn't worth the cab fare to come from Manhattan across the bridge for a pizza. So much for listening to locals.

Old school pizzeria under the Brooklyn bridge, things are simple in this place. The pizza are originally named and HUGE. The places is usually packed and seating is first come, first serve. The pizzas are good and the atmosphere authentic.

Enjoyed the pizza at Grimaldi's. Fresh ingredients and good crust. The line was long so go BEFORE you are hungry. Tried the white pizza which was good but very garlicky and the traditional pizza with italian sausage which was also good.
The Line is out the door. so try to get there earlier because you'll be standing on line waiting for quite some time. Great pizza, more pricey than your average pie but very good.

column3: You have to eat here if you love Pizza!
column4: I am a thin crust pizza girl all the way and boy am I glad we mad the trip to Brooklyn. Definately worth the wait in line. Would go back in a heartbeat! Even my husband loved the pizza and he likes deep dish!

we've been to grimaldi's all over the country -- scottsdale, dallas, foirt myers and highlands, nj -- all offer great pies brooklyn original is an experience with lines outside on cold days and festival seating in the middle -- still cool and worth going
Under new management. Patsy Grimaldi sold the spot and has a new place nearby. Coal oven means crisp crust. Fresh ingredients, good red sauce. Tasty crust. Bit on the heavy side. Price is right.

Visited it here in December, we were in a group of 7. We were seated quickly and the pizza was probably one of the best I have ever tasted, however the service was bad and really ruined the experience.
If you want to taste the best pizza in the world, then you MUST go here PERIOD! Enough said. Pay whatever they ask, who cares, it is the best pizza ever.
We waited about 45 minutes outside and some more inside...but hey...if it's great who cares. It was ! The sinatra dude was singing up a storm and the pizza..unforgettable!
The pizza here was great, we had to wait a while to get in and the service was a little spotty, but it was a fun night out with some good pie.

column3: Not all it's cracked up to be
column4: Pizza was good, but not as good as I expected. Made fresh which you can watch from your table. Fair prices
Lines are definitely too long and the pizza is okay compared to Front Street Pizza which is only 2 blocks away.
Rude staff and pretty ordinary pizza. It's one those places that still lives on because it used to be good and is still in the guide books. If you are staying in Manhattan it is not worth the trek.

Really like the new location. Hasn't changed quality of pizza! Always worth the wait in line! Service was a little slower compared to last visit, but it was nice to not feel rushed out of the restaurant.
it is not worth the lines. This is New York, it is not hard to find spectacular pizza. No need to wait in line on the sidewalk, just explore the neighborhood!

I think the good reviews have gone to the owner¬¥s head as his rudeness is truly breathtaking. Pizzas were average. Worth it if you are in the area and want a pizza but don¬¥t go out of your way for it.

We love Grimaldis in San Antonio. And waited in line for the original. And it was awesome. The whole experience is worth the effort and the staff and the coal fired pizza met every expectation. Much happiness!

column3: In the point of view of a twelve year old
column4: This is by far the best pizzeria in New York it's a true brooklyn jem. If you're visiting New York and you want a genuine New York experience I'd would go here immediately.
Coal fired,fresh mozzarella,thin crust,pizza I have yearned for since I was a kid growing up in little Italy. Their regular entrees are pretty good also,good size portions.
Quite honestly the best pizza I have ever had in my life! Worth queuing outside for and totally worth the wait! Exceptional!

column3: Good pizza but not the best
column4: No wait in line. Ordered two different pizzas and they were good but not the best. Service is average with no personality. Tables are close and intimate but generally clean. Would not wait over 20 mins for it.

column3: Worth the trek and the wait.
column4: Brilliant! This place is amazing value and the pizza was just fantastic. Light, fresh ingredients... worth the ride to Brooklyn.

This place can have quite the waiting line, but it is worth it. The pizza is delicious (thin crust, fresh mozzarella) and the atmosphere is charming. I would highly recommend eating here and then walking across the Brooklyn Bridge. It was a fantastic experience!

We visitied the Douglaston location. Salad and Pizza were great. Service was a bit slow but it seemed they may have been short the night went. I have been a few times and normally the service is better.
Went at around 4.30 Place was busy Got a large between us and added more toppings to it Was the best Service good too
We called in an order and did take out to avoid the long lines. The Pizza was good but nothing special.

column3: Excellent coal fired oven pizza under the Brooklyn Bridge
column4: Excellent pizza with a thin, crisp crust and fresh mozzarella. Service was perfect. Prices are very reasonable. This pizza is worth the trip. Note that Grimaldi's does not take credit cards so bring cash.

column3: 45 Mins wait outside for the best Pizza Ever
column4: Simple & superb, probably the best Pizza we have ever had. Very Limited menu, but what was on offer was excellent. Cash only accepted which may have been a problem if we hadn't had enough with us.
Good pizza... if you get there right when it opens. With so many good places around, it's definitely not worth waiting hours to get a pie.
Been in march & September 2012 and both visits were a treat.. Great buzz about the place, cheery staff and great pizza... NYCs best pizza? Just maybe....

column3: Great food with a little attitude
column4: When you have to wait in line just to order take out must mean something. The pizza was amazing but the guy taking take out orders was pissy.
Last time my wife and I had this was 3 years ago. When we went back last week, didn't change my mind that Grimaldi's is still the best pizza in the world!!!
OK pie. Too long a line. Too many tourists in that line. Better to find a local pizza joint without the cachet.

column3: so good. But not good enough for that line
column4: I used to go all the time, but the line of tourists reached epic propotions and the quality is not quite what it once was.

column3: At least its cheap and the line moved quickly
column4: We had to try it because you know - its Grimaldi's. We could have gotten a better meal just about anywhere. The pizza was bland and the service was indifferent but at least it was inexpensive. Dont' bother.
Not worth waiting on line for. A tourist trap. There are so many more authentic NYC pizza places and this one isn't it. Try Keste's instead. It's in Greenwich Village.
The location is a bit tricky to get to and the queue is long but well worth it. The pizzas are delicious and the staff is nice. The prices are also very reasonable. Well worth a visit!
quite good pizza, best is location below bridge, and peeking at celebrity photos on walls (drawbacks, limited menu, ok service, crowded)
Taking order took too long, about 10 minutes. Stuff is unfriendly and seems to be uninterested. Pizza was tasty.
There is ALWAYS a line. Great pizza but there is great pizza all around. Only worth the wait if you want to say 'I was there'.
The place was very busy we we only had to wait 20 minutes. The pizza was delicious and the service was efficient. We were not disappointed after all the things we had heard.
The pizza was excellent - portions are massive (this was my first experience of American food to be fair!). The restaurant was busy (with good reason) with service being friendly.
This is absolutely the best pizza I've ever had!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! HANDS DOWN

Perfect place for lunch/dinner either before or after you walk across the Brooklyn Bridge (depending on which way you are going to walk)...many celebrities have been seen in there and the pizza is undeniably yummy.
By far the best pizza I ever had!!! Very very tasty and ingredients are fresh....service is also great.....yes sometimes the line is long but worth the wait definitely a must try while in nyc!
Loved the pizza and atmosphere. I believe they have remodeled now to accommodate more patrons. W had to wait about thirty minutes at 11:30 Sunday morning, but it was totally worth it.
Always so fresh and a classic pizza spot in Brooklyn. Nothing like New York Pizza! It's worth the wait if you don't mind waiting, and remember there is no delivery just pick up and dine in!

column3: Best pizzeria in Brooklyn and probably in New York City!
column4: It is worth the long wait to eat pizza at Grimaldi's! Great ambience and good prices. Totally recommended.
My daughter and I ordered just the 6 piece pie and still had to leave 2 pieces behind! The atmosphere, along with the food, was super awesome!
The pizzeria is located in a cool neighborhood, great food and then a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge! It's all good!
We ordered a small pizza to split. I thought they had gotten the order wrong. The small is twice the size of normal large pizza at home. This pizza was the best tasting pizza I have ever eaten.
The pizza is great! Crust delicious as well. Good service. Ordered the small size and 3 of us shared it. Priced right.

column3: Energy after a long walk over the bridge
column4: I waited in a long line in 90 degree heat to eat at this joint. You are seated at a long table with strangers. We ordered a pizza with buffalo mozz! I ate half the pizza myself it was so delish.
Even though the line to get in was long, it was worth it. The pizza was delicious. Enjoyed watching the crusts being made while we waited for our food. Service was very prompt.

we love these pizza it was so exquisite and also we think it's cheap. DUMBO where the pizzeria it's located it's and excellent place because you can see brooklyn and manhattan bridge. It's a really nice seaport.
Grimaldi's didn't disappoint. We got right in, had great service, and the best pizza I've ever eaten. Incredible crust!
The new location offered tons of room. In fact this was the first time we didn't ave a wait. Pizza was as good as ever.
Delicious! Worth the wait and the calories. Best pizza I ever ate.

column3: Very good authentic NY style pizza
column4: Visited Grimaldi's from out of town. My daughter took us there -- she lives in Brooklyn. I was looking for authentic NY style pizza. Grimaldi's was what I was looking for. Crowded, long line, etc., but the pizza was very good. Memorable.
Great pizza! Usually a wait, but we got in pretty quick! There's a good time to get in but you'll have to figure that out yourself! This is a must, especially after walking off the Brooklyn Bridge!
No news. The long line and hour wait just to be seated says it all. The pizza is the best! and once you are seated, the pizza will be in front of you in no time at all. Fresh, delicious pizza.
Standard pizza fare. Recently re-located from down the street. Sitting in the front we were able to watch the pies being made Good soft drinks from Brooklyn. Service good--famous reputation.
There is a reason there is a line down the sidewalk outside this Brooklyn pizzeria. The pizza is the best I have had in the U.S. Only Italy is better than this.

The wait is long, sometimes very long but its a classic Brooklyn Pizzeria that can be worth the wait on a nice day. Inside is small and not fancy but the pizza is good and is cooked in a coal brick oven.
Loved the pizza and the history of the place. I recommend you get there early to avoid huge lines. We walked the Brooklyn Bridge back to wear off our delicious pizza!
Really good pizza but not worth the wait the second time around.

Take a morning to walk across the Brooklyn Bridge, from Manhattan to Brooklyn, and then reward yourself with a real italian pizza. Have in mind that you will probably have to make a line...the place is always full!
Line's too long, not so stand out that it's worth the wait.

We discovered Grimaldi's whilst walking to the Brooklyn Bridge. Wow ... What a pleasant surprise. Waited for 45 minutes in the queue and an additional 45 minutes for our pizzas (it was lunchtime Saturday). Simple yet awesomely tasty pizzas. Lovely Italian ambiance.
Best pizza on the planet. If you don't try this. Well, you wont have the best pizza on the planet

Walked here from the Brooklyn Bridge. Well worth the wait with the lunch crowd. Best pizza i've ever had!! Prices were reasonable and the food came really quick. Met some locals as well and got some great sight seeing tips and ideas.
My kids and I ended up outside of Grimaldi's and decided to go in for pizza. We were not dissapointed. The smell of pizza and the oven brick stove were wonderful!!. Staff was nice as well!
Went here on the Brooklyn Pizza tour, the pizza was fantastic, well worth a visit.

This pizza was awesome. The crust was perfect and they were not stingy with the toppings. We tried the white pizza which had just the right amount of garlic and seasonings. The pepperoni pizza was equally as great. Too bad they don't deliver to TN!!!
I think its become a little touristy!!! Pizza was good but was it because we were starving........ ? Restaurant was busy, not sure if I would make the effort to go again.
Great brick oven pizza! Plan to wait about 45 minutes - 1 hour to be seated. Make sure to bring cash, as they do not accept credit cards.

column3: Long line outside but great pizza
column4: The pizza is excellent and the line, although long, moved fairly quickly. You can burn some of the calories off by walking to the restaurant via the Brooklyn Bridge. If you in lower Manhattan the walk is doable and the views outstanding.
After moving to Arizona I was glad to see Grimald's Pizzeria. They bring in all the ingredients from back east. In 5 years I have not found a pizza place that comes close to Grimaldi's in Arizona.
You can find better pizza in many other places! Not worth waiting for!
Pizza made fresh in a brick oven. The wait is 45 min to 1 hour. Try the white pizza with basil.
Like the great pizza places of New Haven, you will wait at Grimaldi's. However, a must on the Brooklyn pizza tour.

column3: The right place at the right time.....with pizza!
column4: Great pizza in a perfect location beneath the Brooklyn Bridge, and the food was good ,too.
We ordered takeout and they had delicious pizza! Nice and thin, not overly greasy, and not too salty. Everything was just right! Well worth the wait (if you have time)!
very fresh and tasty pizze. The pies have a delicious thin crust topped with a fresh sauce. lines may be long.
Was there a line? Yes. Did we wait long? 70 Minutes. Was it worth it ? YES
its very good pizza, but today its like alot of other brick over pizza places and doesnt rate extremely high on my list.
Good pizza! The char it gets from the coal brick oven adds a different flavor profile that you don't get often. Priced reasonably well, too.

column3: A Great Vibe and Good Pizza
column4: As always, the queue. Did our 45 min+ wait and had a great lunch. A very special place to visit with fantastic pizza. A very good vibe amongst diners.
something a bit different to the usual by-the-slice fare in the city. nice pizza, quick service.

You might have to wait in line for a short bit but the pizza is well worth the wait. If the weather is nice, walk back across the Brooklyn Bridge afterwards. The views are incredible and you can walk off some of the calories!
I'm Italian, so I tend to be very strict when it comes to pizzerias abroad, but this was very, very nice!
You have to buy an entire pie, no slices. To me their pizza is dry and rubbery.
worth the wait---- I can't wait to try it in the new location

column3: The outside line doesn't equal the best pizza but it is good
column4: Good but just not worth the long wait both outside and inside-1.5 hour and half for one pizza and very hot inside, get a fan with all the money they make.
Always crowded, but not worth the wait. Totonno's in Coney Island blows this place out of the water.
They serve a good pizza, but their pizza was as good as my local pizzeria! I didn't have to line up but I don't think it's worth the wait if there's a long queue to get in.
The guy who is the hostess is a very stupid old man, and we waited like 1 hour to have the pizza wicha was just normal..

The pizza was pretty good, but it wasn't good enough for me to wait 30-40 minutes outside in line again. I would eat there again if I didn't have to wait. The service was great though. Warm, friendly and efficient.

column3: Not all its cracked up to be
column4: Heard a lot about this place; the famous people whom have eaten their but we found it very average. Pizza was huge and value for money, but don't go if you have great expectations.

Grimaldi's has moved up the street to #1 Front St. They open at Noon. We waited in line and didn't regret it. We thought the pizza was great and our service was good. They don't sell slices and they only take cash.
One of the best pizzas I've ever eaten! We had to wait about half an hour to get seated and then about another half hour for our pizza, but it was worth it!

column3: Don't wait on line ! Call ahead
column4: Do your a big favor and call ahead 20-30 mins before you go to order a pie. This way you can walk in and grab your pie and not wait on line with all the tourist and hipsters waiting for a slice/pie..........................
Great pizza, not to expensive. Neat atmosphere. Wait staff I would not say is very friendly. But great pizza.
VEry VERY good pizza, but I still do not think its as great as its hype. It doesn't really differentiate itself from the other great brick oven pizzas in the neighborhood.
Go to Luigi's on 5th ave and 21st St. in Brooklyn and get the special with the fresh mozzarella and the pesto,basil sauce.
You have to wait on line and the seating is a bit close but the Pie is worth it!!
A great location and delicious thin crust pizza. Sometimes there is a line so if you go at lunch time don't go too hungry.
It was just OK. Pizza is pizza. There was no line for a change so we were in quick.
Grimaldi's has the best thin crust pizza I have ever tasted. They also are very accommodating to their guests. The food it great, the people are great, and you will leave super full!
Just go and dont ask question until after you eat! Standing in line might not seem worth while but in the end you will be so glad that you did! Enjoy the area afterwards!

The hype around Grimaldi's prompted us to walk from the subway to the Brooklyn location. The pizza was just ok. The sauce was good. Mozzarella was dry and tasteless. Crust was ok. There are other pizza places that are better.

column3: Didn't even get a bite to eat"
column4: They threw us out! We asked for a table for six - four of us were in the restaurant and two of us 50 meters away outside. A very arrogant man showed us out and made us wait behind a certain line. I have never...More
A great location and delicious thin crust pizza. Sometimes there is a line so if you go at lunch time don't go too hungry.

column3: You go there for the pizza ‚Äîyou don't come back because of the service
column4: The pizza was great, but the service wasn't at the same level. There was a russian waiter who was very rude and disrespectful. Honestly, I don't understand what he's doing serving in a restaurant because he's disgusting. The wine was too warm, the waiters were clueless but the pizza was awesome. A pity.

Really atmospheric run-down old bank pretty much under the ramps to Brookyn Bridge at no1 Front st.  High quality juicy pizzas with an emphasis on marscapone which makes them really succulent. A good value pitcher of house red to go with your pizza and you're made!  High quality furniture shops nearby for a good browse at the right time of day plus the unforgettable experience of walking under Manhattan bridge as trains THUNDER across. People live here?!!
It was just OK. Pizza is pizza. There was no line for a change so we were in quick.
Grimaldi's has the best thin crust pizza I have ever tasted. They also are very accommodating to their guests. The food it great, the people are great, and you will leave super full!
Just go and dont ask question until after you eat! Standing in line might not seem worth while but in the end you will be so glad that you did! Enjoy the area afterwards!

1st time trying the pies at Grimaldi's have heard a lot of great things about the pizza and it was all true. They only take cash but the prices are very reasonable. I spent $30 for a pie, 3 drinks and tip. Parking is a little tricky but I found a spot. Already planning to dine here again next time I'm in NYC

The hype around Grimaldi's prompted us to walk from the subway to the Brooklyn location. The pizza was just ok. The sauce was good. Mozzarella was dry and tasteless. Crust was ok. There are other pizza places that are better.

column3: Pizza from Sinatra's youth might have drawn crowds to this famous place or was it because he was there?
column4: Pizza from Sinatra's youth might have drawn crowds to this famous place or was it because he was there? Today, his photos cover the walls but sadly the pizza is not great, the service is poor and it still draws unsuspecting tourists, like us, so beware...this is not a good pizza restaurant and I can always trust my best critic...my stomach ...which did not take too long to prove my point....hardly worth the trip to Brooklyn for this hugely over-rated joint.
I loved the pizza here...walk over the Brooklyn bridge and have a feast! get a taxi back because you wont be able to move afterwards!
I don't know what kind of fairy dust they sprinkle on their pizzas, but they have an addictive flavor. We eat at Grimaldis once or twice a month.
The best end to a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge ever!

column3: OVER RATED but the pizza isnt bad
column4: OVER RATED but the pizza isnt bad. Dont understand what all the fuss is about.
Probably the best brick oven in Brooklyn. Worth the wait on line.

column3: Long wait time but good food
column4: Good Food was there a few years ago. When i went i had a long wait but the food is good.
The pizza here is really good. I love thin crust and the slices are pretty big. The sauce is excellent also. The service was not bad for a busy time. I would eat here many times again!
You will need to fight for your food but it is worth it. The parking and the wait are rough but the pizza is original.
Simply awesome!! Only had to wait about 20 mins and it was well worth it. Its moved just up the road into a new buliding that has a lot of character. Go a large between 2 people and use your hands!!
This was the best Pizza I have ever tasted. I never believed people when they say you haven't had pizza until you've had NY pizza. I'm a believer now!

column3: Still best pizza! And better new location:)
column4: We've been regular for at least 5 years! It's never a disappointment. Always great! And huge line is a confirmation to that. Can't imagine new york without it.
Waited 1.5 hrs.. Only to be greeted by rude serive. Inbuilt gratitude, but didn't state it on bill properly (4 ppl). I wouldn't even bother..

column3: Lines can be out the door
column4: Is it the best -- it's very good, had better. Like Patricia's in Williamsburg better and you're not rushed.
